Reviews.Title: “Not great, not bad”
Reviews.Author: rjung10
Reviews.Content: Location - great. Parking - not happy ever about paying $20 a night to park but it is what I expected. Rooms - above average furnishings, below average bathroom, comfortable enough. Staff - not over-the-top-friendly, not rude For a hotel I would normally say that this place would be a 4 star. However, for the price point, I would expect a bit more. The staff COULD have been nicer. Two times I walked by a bellman with 2 bags, 1 double stroller, and 1 basket, juggling everything together on the stroller. Not only did he not offer to help (isn't that his job), he pretended not to see me and didn't hold or open the door for me. When I asked the check-in lady a question, she looked at me as if I asked her the most ridiculous question (asked about cancellation policies). She gave me a simple 'no' answer. It wasn't rude, per se, but it wasn't polite either. Checkout was a nightmare. A line that was at least 25 guests long (all from the same party). Took forever. I would normally just do a checkout via phone but I wanted to change the credit card that would be charged for parking. Oh well. Location - while the location is great, it is not great. My friend stayed at the Hilton Torrey Pines. Now that is a GREAT location. This location is in the right vicinity but not the exact right spot. The only thing it has going for it location-wise is the Flemings across the entrance. I would stay here again if I could get a room for about 80 bucks (priceline or something). Add to that parking ($20/night) and $100 is about max I would pay out of pocket. Anymore than that (and they routinely charge over 200 a night) and I wouldn't even hesitate to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Location and common areas above average, rooms just OK”
Reviews.Author: DavidfromMadison
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first part of our spring break trip to Southern Cal. The location is very convenient to downtown and northern communities. First impression is very good, with nice lobby and common areas. The rooms were not as nice. Lots of stains on the walls and peeling wall paper. The beds were adequate, but not as nice as Westins. We could hear our neighbors toilets flushing constantly. The pool area was very nice, with lots of space. If you like fine dining, there are very good restaurants right on the property. The gym is also very nice with lots of eqiipment.

Reviews.Title: “The Details about Hyatt La Jolla”
Reviews.Author: DenverREO
Reviews.Content: Parking.....you can park for free on the street....drive around once to see your options. $25 for vallet or $20 for self park. Vellet parking service was poor. They need much more training and a better attitude. If I call down and can see my car sitting a few feet away I should not have to stand around more than a few minutes for it... in our case we asked several times, pointed it out, was told the gal was new and the two guys standing around did not want to tell her how to do her job so we decided to walk to get our car ourselves...where is the team spirit? we parked on the street the rest of our stay but were still charged for vallet. Quick trip to the front desk corrected the charge. 4 upscale eats across the entry like Melting Pot and Japengo....or two blocks on the other side of I-5 for Wholefoolds, Ralphs, Trader Joes and few cheep eats like Rubios and Sprinkes Cupcakes... yum! Ask front desk for area map. Easy access to I-5 and quick trip to San Diego Zoo, Old Town or hiking at Torrey Pines....dont miss this. Pool area was very nice and well heated even on chilly days. Towels available at the pool. Nice additional seating areas around pool as well. Wifi is $9.95 in rooms but business pods on lower level and 2nd floor are free and worked well. No problems with printing. Stay Fit gym had what was needed to get the job done or pay extra to use the one next door. Room was nice and bed comfy room but had a few moisture problems. Stayed in 729 and had mold in ceiling in bathroom, vent fan did not appear to work and main room windows were filled with water dripping down them after 2 showers..... so much so that created puddles.

Reviews.Title: “One of a kind!”
Reviews.Author: Krysani B
Reviews.Content: I was in ROOM!!!{write this down!! 1112, The numbers indicate It's on the 11th floor! =) ROOM 12, clean all granite throughout the bath room, They were Kind, and willing to serve, you felt @ HOME, My son threw up Just before we arrived, and they offered Free Laundry!! the first 12 Item{S}, it was great! For a "FOUR STAR" Hotel they don't offer a morning appetite, they should have a like a greetings/ Tone of voice or generosity type of offer when checking INN, half off etc, specails, they just look @ you and point to the Restuarnt within the hotel area

Reviews.Title: “Nice Spring Break stay!”
Reviews.Author: sarahdsmom
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here, the staff is friendly, comfortable beds & plenty of pillows and the hotel and grounds are beautiful. I do think the rooms need some updating with the wallpaper & tile in bathrooms other than that it was comfortable & quiet. I noticed the light out at the entry and a slight smell from the sink drain and informed Melanie at the desk and it was taken care of while we were out for the day.I was concerned when I didn't see a coffee machine so I called the desk and they let me know it was stored on the top shelf in the closet and sure enough it was there. I bid on this hotel on Priceline and won it for under $100, picking San Diego Coastal and while La Jolla is coastal, this hotel is about 10 miles from any water.It is conveniently right off the I-5. The hotel is a short drive to the Westgate UTC mall, we ate breakfast at the Cocos across the street. The night we arrived at the hotel we went to Melting Pot to eat which is right across the driveway from the hotel along with a sushi and steak place. For a family of 4 the bill was $89 and only one of us had wine, a little too pricey for me. The room we were given was on the 11th floor and a view of the well heated pool. This pool is shared with a nice gym in the complex but it was never too crowded and plenty of towels on hand and nice cabanas that most hotels require you to reserve & pay for but not this Hyatt. The pool is set up so people from the hotel can swim & not interfere with lap swimmers from the gym. The hot tub was just luke warm on the second night and a call to the desk had maintenance out there in less than 15 minutes to fix it. They offer you the option to use the big fancy gym for $13 a day but the hotel has it's own smaller gym that is free. I could pick up the Wifi by the pool that is offered free from their lounge-Michael's. I would stay here again but only if I was able to snag it for under $100, there is a parking fee $20 or $25 for valet. Since I got a good deal on the hotel I didn't mind the fee. There is parking on the street but this hotel is surrounded by office complexes and it seemed to me most of the street parking was taken. I was very happy with the Valet & the Bell person, both offered great service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, with small complaints”
Reviews.Author: teheteha
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights with a group rate for a wedding. Actually spent quite a bit of time at the hotel because wedding events were on site in the downstairs ballroom both nights. We arrived around 12:30 p.m. and a non-smoking two-queen-bed room wasn't ready yet (not complaining, just stating) so we checked our bags with the bellhop and drove to downtown La Jolla. The front desk staff weren't that friendly at check-in (nor during the rest of the visit, they were OK, but nothing special), though the bell service staff was more friendly. They called when our room was ready, which was nice. Our room was on the third floor with a view of the front of the hotel and restaurants across the driveway. Not that exciting, but kind of fun to watch all the comings-and-goings. When we got off the elevator, it smelled like cigarette smoke, which continued as we walked down the hall. Inside our room though was fine. Just annoying to have to walk through the scent every time we made a trip from the elevator. Room was clean and nice, with small windows you could actually open for some fresh air. Bathroom was fine as well, with usual amenities plus toothpaste. Our room was never made up though by housekeeping on the next day of our two-night stay, which seemed very odd. We were gone for about five hours total during daytime hours, and were surprised to find it as we left it. We finally got a knock on the door around 5:30 p.m. asking if we'd like housekeeping to make up the room -- at least they finally came, but at that point we were in the middle of getting ready for the wedding that night so declined the service. I feel like 5:30 p.m. is pretty late for housekeeping, even if the hotel is busy (we saw carts on our floor earlier in the day, so not sure why we were overlooked). We didn't get any knocks on the door earlier in the day and didn't have a "do not disturb" sign out or anything. We did track someone down later for extra towels and bathroom amenities. Spent some time in the Michael's bar both days between sightseeing and evening events. It's a little pricey, but typical of hotels, so to be expected. Staff was friendly enough, good seating options indoors and outdoors (though some weird stains on the chairs) and a decent atmosphere, too. Also, the ballroom was a nice space for the wedding and smaller pre-wedding ceremony. There's also a Starbucks in the lobby, which is handy for a quick coffee or breakfast snack. Parking here isn't the greatest, but it works. It's $20 for self-park, $25 for valet. We did self-park. We got a $10 coupon for parking at the on-site ceremony, but were informed at the front desk it's only for local people (so locals get a discount, but not guests of the hotel spending a few hundred dollars?). The parking garage is mostly underground, and fairly dark -- could use some more lighting. It felt safe, but just dark. Also, you have to take separate elevator or stairs from inside the hotel, so it's two separate rides down (with a walk outside in between) to get from the garage to the hotel. The location is fine in that it's right by I-5 so easy freeway access, but it's not really walking distance to anything. We stayed here because the wedding was here, but otherwise would rather be walking distance to downtown La Jolla. Overall, this is a fine place to stay, quite nice in a lot of ways -- I just found a lot to nitpick. However, still worthy of a stay if you want to be close to the UCSD campus or otherwise like the location.

Reviews.Title: “This place is NOT worth the $$$”
Reviews.Author: Allison S
Reviews.Content: I traveled to La Jolla to attend an appointment with my father at Moores Cancer Center. The Hyatt was close by and since we did not know the area, we assumed it would be just fine. We arrived at 3:00 for check in,and met the not so lovely Olga, then told our 1 king room was ready, problem, I reserved a 2 queen room. No apology, nothing just the same sentance over and over, "We've been sold out for the last 2 days". My sick father wanted to lay down instead of sit in the lobby for an additional 50 min. Which by the way was ready and no one bothered to inform us, who was sitting 9 feet away. The room was fine, no free parking, wi-fi or even a damn robe. I am reminded why I love the Doubletree after this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, attractive, typical Hyatt adds on fees”
Reviews.Author: kmuch
Reviews.Content: If you're going to UCSD or Scripps, the Hyatt is a fine choice. It's not meant for vacationers who want to be near the beach or tourist attractions. Rooms are spacious and well appointed, with comfortable beds. Be prepared for a hefty $20/day parking charge and $10/day for an Internet connection--Hyatt has succumbed to airline-add-on disease. Breakfast is overpriced, but the dining room is pleasant. You may prefer to breakfast in the lobby Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Expensive Parking”
Reviews.Author: GurlieGirl
Reviews.Content: When travelling to San Diego, I always wonder why not just build the price of the parking into the room rate. I always feel like I'm getting a good rate on the travel websites but then end up paying basically the normal rate because of the jacked up parking prices. Over $20 a night to park a car is nothing short of ridiculous. There is on street parking, if you're lucky enough to get back to the hotel early. But who wants to spend their entire evening in the hotel? And then there's the hike back to the hotel after parking the car on the street. The rest of the stay was awesome. The hotel is beautiful and we had a room on an upper floor so had a great view. The clerk at the front desk was extremely helpful and very courteous. We were offered cookies and juice as we walked to the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Attend event; stay overnight”
Reviews.Author: patient111
Reviews.Content: I hadn't stayed at the Hyatt Regency in La Jolla for many years, so I was pleasantly surprised to find it in great shape for a local fundraising event. Spent the night to avoid a drive home. The courtyard has The Melting Pot, Cafe Japengo, and Fleming's. The bar in the Hyatt, Michael's, is also warm and inviting. On the 12th floor, I had a clean, comfortable room overlooking the courtyard. There is a coffee maker in the room and a Starbuck's just off the lobby. The staff was courteous, unobtrusive, and professional. I'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Shame about parking charges.”
Reviews.Author: RogerHolgate
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel, good sized rooms with a nice outdoor pool / spa. Near resturants and local shopping. The only thing that soured our stay was the extortionate $20 a day parking fees. Come on guys - you are not an inner city hotel lacking parking, its just daylight robbery!

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: farley170
Reviews.Content: We stayed at la jolla hyatt in january 2012 i was a little concerned when reading reviews for the hotel but on arriving at the hotel was suprised to find how efficent & friendly the staff were contary to reviews. Edwin from the restaurant could not do enough for us at breakfast & all staff was extremly helpfull. we had a wonderfull time in such a wonderfull setting & will return next year. Thank you for our wonderful stay. Karen & Stewart Tittley, UK

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms & meeting facilities.”
Reviews.Author: trvlr7311
Reviews.Content: Was just there for a conference. Excellent conference facilities and location to restaurants. Temperature of the rooms and acoustics were just right. I really do object to paying for Wifi, but I have my own wireless Wifi, so I don't pay the fees. Always astounds me that any Holiday Inn Express will provide free Wifi, but a Hyatt, Westin, etc, at twice the nightly rate, won't provide it. In today's world that is just unacceptable. I even have a Hyatt Gold Card and still would have had to pay. Ok, enough for that rant. Room was excellent, bed comfortable. Great workout facility.

Reviews.Title: “La Jolla Business hub, large health club, good conference logistics”
Reviews.Author: DoesNotGetOutMuch
Reviews.Content: Visited for a 3 day meeting where 400 people attended. This was handled del with good acoustics and AV and excellent food options at buffer across courtyard including vegetarian. Rooms are a good size, shower over bath, standard Hyatt, comfortable, clean, internet option wired or wireless at 9.95 basic. The executive lounge on 16 runs a happy 3 hour from 5-8pm with a good selection of antipasto , cheese, dips etc with an honor bar for alcohol. It has 2 PCs and printer for logging in and boarding passes. Very large well appointed gym and pool etc. Taxi to SD airport 20 minutes, $45.

Reviews.Title: “Regency Club”
Reviews.Author: cfnm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hyatt for 2 nights. Room was very nice, but we had a family staying in the room next to us that woke us up at 6:00 am because they were playing (screaming) with their dad. i banged on the wall.... no problems after that. Regency Club was very nice, especially the ladies that work there. Daisy helped my ailing husband (i think food poisoning... not saying from where, cause we're not sure). She gave me banana, toast, ginger ale, bottled water to take to the room. Also, room service made him a grilled cheese with soup (not on the menu), put a rush on it.... had it in 15 minutes. Parking was not that great. $25 a night to stay in their garage, or street parking for free (if you can find one) They have a very nice, helpful guy in the lobby that will help you with anything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Erica A
Reviews.Content: Overall, I would rate this hotel a 4-4.5. I stayed at the Hyatt for work and was very impressed by the excellent service we received. We had group of about 40-50 staying in the same hotel. The rooms were very clean and nice although I did dock one point from rating because there were no outlets placed in spots that would seem obvious. For example, they have a very nice large mirror near the closet, but not outlets by the mirror. The only outlets in the room area that was in a reachable place was near the desk and the desk did not have a mirror. However, the flip side to this situation is that room service was nice enough to bring us an electrical strip so we could place it near our bedside table. Also, the pillows look very comfortable at first, and then as the night goes on they tend to sink a little too much. I ended up sleeping on 2-3 pillows since it would sink down by the morning. The gym is an excellent facility and helped us stay in shape since we were there for 1.5 weeks. The heated pool and hot tub was also great, although the pool area did close earlier than we would have liked. The doormen and front desk were very helpful with every request. The front desk was able to assist with any internet questions, free coffee vouchers, shuttles or ground transportation. The doormen were amazing at helping us transport the large group and assisting in getting taxis or car services ready for us.They also would recommend places to go or eat when they had the chance to. Room Service did an excellent job helping fix and accomodate whatever we needed. We had some minor problems with the toilet, but Engineering came promptly to fix the issue. The hotel bar had a great fireplace outdoor to roast marshmallows or just hang out. The lounge inside was a good place to unwind after a long day, grab a bite or drink. The hotel is located near the La Jolla downtown, the USC and Scripps campus, the mall, and a few shopping centers. The location is good if you don't mind staying around La Jolla or have a rental car to drive around. It is not close to Gas Lamp or downtown. I would stay here again if I am visiting the La Jolla area or renting a car to travel around San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “What you would expect from a Hyatt Regency, but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: Perry-Greena
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal on Priceline and stayed at the Hyatt Regency over the weekend. The front office staff were helpful and friendly. Upon my departure at 5am the valet attendant on duty was notably courteous as well and helpful and provided excellent customer service even though we didn't part at the valet. He offered to help with bags, gave directions to the airport, and genuinely considerate. If I were scoring the stay based only on him I would have given a 10 star. The room could hae been cleaner. There were hairs in the tub and spots on the carpet. For a Hyatt Regency this was below standard. Free internet at the bar was a plus!

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive”
Reviews.Author: Fernando1818
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel with very friendly staff and wonderful areas

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: GeminiCa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hyatt for 3 nights during a recent business trip. The hotel is nice and the staff is friendly. The beds are wonderfully comfortable and the WIFI convenient. However, during the 3 nights of my stay, every night there was no hot water. The first night I was told that they had "some issues" that were being fixed but for the remainder of my stay the problem was not corrected. The bathtub was very dated and had several rust stains which I did not expect from a Hyatt Regency. The parking was expensive and very inconvenient to self park so I had to rely on valet which was even more expensive. Room service was on time but $50 for an egg white omelet a small bowl of fruit and a coffee seemed outrageous. Overall it is a decent place to stay but next time I'd prefer a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ScottM1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times. They always offer clean rooms, pleasant staff and are in a great location. The coffee shop in the lobby offers nice cheap and healthy lunches. The gym is more than adequate and access to all parts of San Diego is easy. There is also 4G WiMAX coverage in this hotel for the business traveller and in that way one can avoid WiFi charges.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and friendly staff but not the quality I expect from Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: gaffnut4
Reviews.Content: The service was terrific and the staff was very professional. The location is great. However, I just didn't feel that I was staying at a Hyatt. The lobby is modern but with an awkward and empty feel to it. The rooms had modern muted colors but the furniture was bare bones basic with a build it yourself feel. The walls were thin, thin, thin and the doors were as light as a feather. I wasn't even sure the door was properly locked because it did not have a tight close. It is obviously an acquired property that they didn't completely renovate just put the veneer on. Comfortable but if you are looking for something of better quality I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Comfort”
Reviews.Author: desertjoe
Reviews.Content: We wanted to meet up with other family members spending Christmas in downtown San Diego but not in the same hotel so we went through Priceline and specified a different area of the City. We were delighted when the Hyatt Regency, La Jolla accepted our bid as I had stayed previously. The hotel thoroughly deserves its 4 Star rating. The welcome started from the moment the valet opened our car door on arrival. Cheerful and helpful staff throughout our five night stay made it a wonderful Christmastime Holiday for us. This Hyatt Regency is luxuriously appointed with well kept gardens and a huge outdoor pool. Yes...guests were swimming in it and stretching out on the sun loungers in December! There is a small shop by reception selling milk, sodas and snacks until late evening. The hotel has 24 hour room service too if you are outside restaurant hours or want to dine in the privacy of your room.The hotel is very close to Interstate I-5 and you can reach most places of interest around San Diego in a few minutes. The Center of La Jolla Village is a short drive away with its good choice of restaurants serving world wide cuisine and quality shops to browse around. Local seafood is a must. The Hyatt is a highrise building within an area of upmarket apartments and connecting roads but external noises do not intrude and the views are interesting. Bedrooms have climate-controlled air conditioning so no problems with noisy window or wall mounted relics.

Reviews.Title: “Resort without the resort fee. :)”
Reviews.Author: mla11408
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency in La Jolla is a really great hotel. The ROOMS are very clean and up to date. the most important part of course is the bed and it was extremely comfortable and very clean. The BATHROOM is very clean and a good size. Only thing that could be improved would be the water pressure but other than that, its great. i think its only like that because the hotel is trying to stay green and not waste too much water. but other than that, the shower is great and big enough. They also give you complementary toothpaste which i loved. The POOL area was amazing. The hotel has a large swimming pool as well as Jacuzzi, and they even have fire pits which i found to be really great. the swim area really looks like a resort in its own right. The STAFF was great and very helpful. Every time we needed anything, they were friendly and very helpful. i forgot my toothbrush and i also needed so aspirin so my husband called down at 11pm and they opened up the store for him to get aspirin and they had the toothbrush and aspirin ready for him by the time he got down there. they also gave us a page of restaurants in the area to go to dinner. and they were really quick getting us everything we needed. we called down for towels, glasses and pillows at separate times, every time we called they had what we needed to our room within ten minutes. we were very impressed. PARKING, okay parking was a downside a little because it was expensive. 20 dollars for self parking, and 25 for valet. It was really a great hotel over all. STAY HERE

Reviews.Title: “big and corporate, but well-done”
Reviews.Author: Jlstcui
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter & I stayed there recently for three nights. While the hotel is not exactly what you'd call a charmer, the rooms were very nice, the nearby restaurants in the hotel circle are top-notch (we had a dinner at the hotel's Cafe Japengo, and it was not only super-stylish but the food was fine, whether salmon teriyaki or assorted sushi rolls), and the service was very good for the most part. A few criticisms: the parking lot requires a bit of an outside walk to get back to the hotel, and at $20/day, it's not too reasonable. The bed looked great, but wasn't particularly comfortable to sleep in. And the Barcino breakfast restaurant is located in a cavernous space in the lower lobby, which makes it feel drafty no matter what; the food there was quite good, but the service was rather slow and a bit disinterested. Pluses: the front desk service was great -- friendly, quick, and helpful. The valets out front and the parking staff were especially helpful. And finally, I discovered this place through a deal I had not been familiar with on Travelocity: their Top Secret Hotels deal. Through it, you can get super discounts on various hotels; the only thing is, you only get a description and a vague location -- you have to reserve your room before you find out exactly where you're staying. I took a chance on this "4-star hotel in La Jolla for $89/night" and wound up at the Hyatt. All in all, a great deal, despite a few quibbles.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; rooms a little dated”
Reviews.Author: pw9999
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a weekend getaway. The hotel is very nice and well maintained and the staff was helpful and courteous. The breakfast buffet (included in our room rate) was very good, with freshly prepared omelets. We took advantage of a low-cost room upgrade and received a mini-suite that was quite spacious. The only complaints we had with the property was that our floor (five) had an unpleasant smell that did not dissipate even after housekeeping tried to address the issue, and the interior of the bathroom was not as clean as would be expected from a Hyatt Regency. Self-parking is $20/night; valet is $25/night. There are four fine restaurants just across the parking lot from the hotel, including Cafe Japengo, Flemings and The Melting Pot.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Amy46815
Reviews.Content: This hotel is magnificent. The rooms are outstanding, the staff was exceptionally accommodating. Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “world class property”
Reviews.Author: terry l
Reviews.Content: stayed 3 nights in november. Ate downstairs....restaurant food was good. view from room good. sound quality good. concierge suite with food was good for a bunch of grunts. sorry for the mess downstairs, but it was fun. this is a world class property. I would stay here again, if they let me. good stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, lovely grounds”
Reviews.Author: Jeanne D
Reviews.Content: I was here for a work conference. Its a lovely business hotel. Conference food was delicious. It was also night to have an olyimpic sized swimming pool on premise.

Reviews.Title: “Getaway”
Reviews.Author: shopper03
Reviews.Content: We stopped in here for a night from a repositioning cruise and we found it to be a great hotel. The service was awesome, great restaraunts steps out of the front door, great boutique shopping moments away by car. My husband left his suit in the room and he didn't notice for 4 days, when contacted they sent it home by Fed Ex, saved his bacon I'll tell you!!! The room was roomy, clean and comfortable would go back in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with not so good service”
Reviews.Author: Sushar
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt looks like a 4-star hotel with spacious rooms, good furnishings and other facilities (pool, fitness center etc.). The service is ok but not worthy of a 4-star status. Room service staff are friendly but not too prompt to respond to requests (need a reminder sometimes). Their security staff are rude and a little overbearing. As mentioned by other reviewers, self-parking is $20/ valet parking $25 per day and they don't have a refrigerator or coffee maker in the rooms. They basically encourage you indirectly to eat at their expensive restaurants by not providing some of these basic amenities. Overall this hotel is ok for business travellers but I would not recommend it for families.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel with hidden costs”
Reviews.Author: Jason W
Reviews.Content: We went to La Jolla for my wife's birthday and were basically down there to relax around the hotel. Imagine our surprise when we learned that to use the fitness center and pool, we'd have to pay an additional fee. On top of that there was a $20/night self-parking fee neither of which was messaged anywhere on Hyatt's sight when I booked the room. I specifically look for these types of hidden charges now. The room was old with a bit of refurbish. No coffee maker, no refrigerator, an average television. The bed was tough on my back and worse, they had put some kind of additional cushioning on under the fitted sheet which caused it to come undone and thus I was lying directly on the mattress by the middle of the night. There's nothing special about the location and we could have stayed at the nearby Radisson for half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: alecb2008
Reviews.Content: Very welcoming and accomodating staff. Good location. Stores and restaurants nearby. Expensive hotel parking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel/Lacking Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Mona J
Reviews.Content: Friendly/Helpful Staff including Valet Parking Attendees and a very Comfortable bed. Expensive parking $25/day and I am very surprised that each hotel room did not come with a refrigerator and coffee maker including coffee/tea bags and sugar. It is the first time I have stayed in a hotel that do not have additional amenities and that was a big surprise! I would think that a hotel of this caliber would have what a low-end hotel in Las Vegas provide. Someone who I talked to needed a refrigerator for her medication and was treated rudely and told none was available. An attempt was finally made to try to borrow a refrigerator from another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: SuperStarr216
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in the San Diego area and just spent one night to enjoy some time together. All the staff we encountered was amazing! At check in they seemed like they were looking for the best possible room for us, they told me the location and asked me if that would work, I really appreciated that. No coffee maker in the room but that was no problem, I called right down to the front desk and it was brought up by housekeeping in less than 15 minutes. Then housekeeping also helped us set up our computer we were having technical issues and although not her job she was more than happy to help. We decided to self park on the street because we were not interested in paying $20/night for parking...crazy in my opinion. We got a great rate as a surprise hotel from travelocity. The pool was very clean and warm, nice big Jacuzzi and in a great location ten minutes to the beautiful beaches in La Jolla. And in a great plaza where you can enjoy a variety of drinks and dinning without worrying about having to drive. Overall we were very satisfied with our stay, room was clean,the bed was also super comfortable with darkening drapes allowing us to sleep in with a nice set up, and the staff was amazing!!! I do wish that they had balconies to enjoy the view but I guess that's just the hotel design not the hotel itself. The Hyatt is definitely on our radar the next time we travel!

Reviews.Title: “Meh, ive stayed at a lot better hotelz”
Reviews.Author: McLeodLA
Reviews.Content: When you first see this hotel you get the feel of a very nice and clean hotel. The valet parking is kind of rude, its better to self park. The lobby is very cold, and cold feeling as well. Everyone there is very high class and a little snobby. The staff was okay, one of the receptionist was very welcoming but another one was quite rude and kept staring at us as if we didnt belong in this "high class" hotel while we were waiting to get picked up by a friend. The rooms were okay, nothing amazing, seen the exact same rooms at 2 1/2 star hotels. All in all very mediocre. There is a huge selection of nice hotels in san diego and la jolla, i wouldnt recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Just Off I-5”
Reviews.Author: JCD
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, although you will need a car to get around for sightseeing. If you do have a car, there is convenient, available street parking beside the hotel, so we didn't opt for valet. There is a health club, but strangely, you have to access it from the outside. Since we didn't eat here, I can't rate the food. There are too many other choices nearby to eat at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Felina M
Reviews.Content: Hyatt La Jolla is a nice hotel we did not have a car so we can't complain about the parking. However, this hotel is not near a lot so you do either need a car or have to take a taxi everywhere which gets expensive. There is a Whole Foods within walking distance which is nice to get snacks or meals at. Overall good hotel but if you want to be near the beach or anything this isn't the right hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: tm505
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Hyatt Regency this past week for 6 nights while I was attending a conference. The hotel is very conveniently located off I-5, close to all of the main attractions in San Diego. We requested early check-in and our room was ready when we got there around noon, which was really nice. We also requested a fridge, a crib and a coffee maker and all items were delivered promptly. The staff were extremely courteous, pleasant and very responsive - the only negative service experience we had was the wait for the drinks we ordered by the pool - it probably took the waitress 45 minutes to bring a juice and a beer. She was very nice but took way too long to bring the drinks. It was quite chilly the whole time we were there so we could not take advantage of the pool/jacuzzi as much as we had hoped, but that area of the hotel is very nice. We did not eat at any of the restaurants on the property so I cannot comment on those but there are a few restaurants about 5 minutes or so away that are good alternatives to what is being offered at the hotel. Overall, it was a nice stay - the only real complaint I have is the parking charge - $20 per night seems to be a bit excessive but we got around it most days by parking on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Big thanks to a professional and accommodating staff”
Reviews.Author: MiCasaEsSuCasa
Reviews.Content: We came into town just for one night to see friends. There was a line at check-in, so I used the automated check-in service but was informed there was no room available yet (it was 4 pm, however). I then spoke with someone at the front desk and she upgraded us and got us a better room -- that's service in my book. And the next day we asked if we could do a late checkout and again the staff came through to accommodate our request. For a big hotel chain, those little touches make a big difference.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: deboraperez56
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency because of its proximity to UCSD. We are members of Hyatt Passport and thus we stayed at an upgraded suite in the regency floors. We enjoyed breakfast at the Regency Lounge and found service to be excellent. We were greeted upon arrival, checked in our car in valet service and throughout our stay everything went smoothly. We also used the free laundry provided and found the people really enthusiastic and professional. We did not have time to use other facilities suchas the gym or pool or the restaurants even though they seemed busy and upbeat. Very good value and will certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: boboross
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because it's close by UCSD campus where we had a church wide conference in there. The room price we got was unbeatable during the labor day long weekend! We requested early check in and roll away bed which were granted with no hassle! Very comfortable room with plenty of spaces. My family enjoyed the pool very much with heated water! The downside is the parking. There's no free parking in this hotel and the option is to park on the streets. Wifi is $10/day which is on the high end as well. Other than that I highly recommend this hotel if you want to be close to freeway and the campus.

Reviews.Title: “Great two night stay”
Reviews.Author: lucymoosey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in early September at the tail end of our vacation in San Diego. Booked using Priceline.com Name Your Own Price ($120/night- very pleased!). Hotel is gorgeous, everything you would expect from a Hyatt. I knew from other reviewers that parking was an issue ($20/day for self park/$25/day for valet) so we knew to plan accordingly. We easily found street parking every day and multiple times a day since we left for all meals. The restaurants surrounding the hotel are very close, but also pricey- so we drove to the surrounding area for breakfast/lunch/dinner. The room we received was updated, very modern and very clean and nice. It had 2 Queen sized beds, plenty of pillows and a big screen TV. Although we didn't eat any meals there, we did go to the bar, Michael's- service there was great- and they even have gas firepits outside and you can watch TV outside (football games, etc) while enjoying your drinks. It is a sports bar theme, and they give you a "sound box" for your table, so you can hear whatever game you are watching- I thought that was a great idea! We used the pool every day we were there, and it was warm but not obnoxiously warm- just comfortable to dip in, even though the weather was only in the 70s. Nice hot tub too- we used that as well. There are fire pits outside by the pool which are on every night- I saw a sign on the front desk saying they do s'mores out there at 8pm every night, but the night we went no one came out with them. We were very pleased with our stay and would definitely stay here again if we return to the area. In terms of internet/wireless- there is free wireless access which I used in Michael's (bar/lounge)- and also 2 business "pods" located in a hallway on your way out to the pool area where you can use the internet for free for 15 minutes (self timed/honor system)- that was a huge plus. My husband was disappointed that you can't use the gym for free- you have to pay. I'd say that was the only down-side to this hotel. Also, no coffee maker in the room- but they do give you daily passes to obtain free coffee/latte's at Perks, their coffee shop which serves Starbucks coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, depending on your travel plans”
Reviews.Author: melc12
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just east of I-5 so if you're looking to be close to La Jolla village and beaches, you need to drive 10 minutes. This location works for us as freeway access is close but it depends what you want to do and where you want to go on your vacation. Rooms are clean, comfortable and spacious. Cookies and juice are available in the lobby mid-afternoon. Park for free on the street beside the hotel. Sometimes you have to park about 3 minutes walking distance away but it's better than paying for parking. The outdoor pool has two 25 yard lanes for lap swimming. Staff were always attentive to get what we needed such as extra towels, glasses, pillows and mini-fridge. The hotel is in the same complex as Fleming's, an excellent steak restaurant. This is where we will be staying every time we vacation in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: lujoPerscott
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights while I was attending a conference. The hotel was very pretty and had all the amenities including excellent adjacent restaurants. The only reason that it was not excellent was a leaky faucet in the bathroom and the time to get hot water for a shower ... about three to five minutes

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: jimmyp3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during the July 4th holiday visiting family that lives in the vicinity. It is a drive to get downtown to many of the bars and restaurants in the Gaslamp Quarter, but fortunately this hotel complex is fairly self-contained with its own bars and restaurants. The amenities are up-to-date, the staff was friendly, and the pool was always busy. If you stay more than a few days, two shopping centers within walking distance offer additional food options and also a Whole Foods. If you need to stay in this part of San Diego, this hotel is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience Yet”
Reviews.Author: davdaven
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent experience at the Hyatt Regency La Jolla during my 4-night stay at the end of May. I chanced upon an excellent rate and feel that this hotel is worth every penny. The Hyatt has excellent freeway access, a pleasant lobby with courteous front desk staff, clean and modern rooms, a well appointed gym (for free on site--the adjacent sports club has a daily fee), a large pool good for swimming laps or goofing off (also free, shared with the sports club), and an attractive and large hot tub. The hotel is not perfect, though. There is a charge for wi-fi, which seems ridiculous considering there are 2 free workstations. Also, on-site parking is outrageous at $20 per night. However, that can be solved easily by parking on the street for free. I had no trouble finding a spot within half a block of the hotel at all times during my stay. Overall, I had a thoroughly enjoyable stay at the Hyatt and will probably be back, as I visit San Diego a couple times per year. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Breakfast Buffet”
Reviews.Author: KCkcUSA
Reviews.Content: Only complaints are the sheets, walls, and carpets have stains (DNA) near the bed aread and needed to be wiped down, hair in the bathroom floor. Gross, but housekeeping took care of it when asked. they did not apologize for the oversight. This is a great hotel, given the price of AAA rate or 21-day pre-paid non-refundable rate. We took advantage of the AAA rate which is refundable up to 24 hours prior cancellation. The AAA rate is the same as a refundable up to 24 hours prior cancellation but it includes a free breakfast buffet. It is a full American Breakfast Buffet and you can custom order your omelets. The coffee is a smooth strong Columbian. Very courteous staff. Also, they had a balloon artist came in to make balloons for the patrons during breakfast, they only do it on holiday weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Simply relaxing....”
Reviews.Author: alba99tross
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice with a great bathroom that was exceptionally clean and stocked. We enjoyed out two days at the Hyatt and look forward to coming back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel would return”
Reviews.Author: NYCTraveler1980
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here, they have a very nice pool area, good service,clean rooms. We had no real complaints, my only qualm is the 20$/day self parking which seems excessive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff! We'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: debvarner
Reviews.Content: From check in to each one we spoke with, every Hyatt employee was excellent. Very nice common areas, check in, lounge, pool. Excellent "business pods" for internet, etc. Room was fine - nothing special, but very clean and comfortable. Would like to see in-room internet included...

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: watergirl3663
Reviews.Content: Whether for business or pleasure, the Hyatt in LaJolla is a beautiful facility in a central location. Five minutes from wonderful seaside restaurants and beach facilities. Within blocks of the college campus and I-5 interchange. The hotel property is beautifully decorated and the hotel staff welcoming and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “We will not stay at any Hyatt after this.”
Reviews.Author: tripandfun3
Reviews.Content: I booked The Hyatt since I have heard that they were a luxury hotel, The main lobby was but, that was about it. We also stayed at the Doubletree by Hilton in Del Mar and they were way better + they had warm cookies at check in and FREE parking. We payed $20.00 for self parking and $3.00 for a water bottle at the Hyatt nothing was FREE. The halls were very creepy and it was a long walk to the parking garage. The other thing that we did not like was that the floor in the bathroom was stained and dirty, they also had stains up the walls. If felt like there had been fowl play in the room and the cleaners did not do a good job. Overall we would not stay at a Hyatt ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, close to sites”
Reviews.Author: Fotopunk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference. It was comfortable, clean beautiful hotel. Great place for a conference. Really great restaurants within walking distance. Also an easy/close drive to the coast! I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Supremely dull and uninspiring; might suit some business travellers but there are better options in the area”
Reviews.Author: Toaster803
Reviews.Content: Was booked here via corporate travel to attend a conference (not on hotel site) and regretted it from arrival. Curious smell pervades the corridors that resemble rows of prison cells. Room was fully functional but bland; that said I did sleep well. Really object to paying for an internet connection in this grade of hotel, but in fairness the charge was waived on departure. The location, close to I-5 is perhaps convenient for some, but it is a long way from La Jolla village, the closest local attraction. I am surprised it has fared so well on Trip Advisor so perhaps my experience is atypical. The Truluck's steak house opposite is quite excellent and a definite redeeming feature.

Reviews.Title: “Super inconsistent service”
Reviews.Author: StilettoLondon
Reviews.Content: I would love to say that our experience in La Jolla was consistently good, but cannot.. On check-in the staff were exemplary and very helpful with tips for brunch dining the next day and places to see plus maps and all kinds of useful things. Breakfast and brunch at Barcino we experienced excellent service too although there are better value options in La Jolla Village with great food and atmosphere, so Barcino as a breakfast or lunch venue on site is, however, convenient. The Michaels Bar was either rammed full or totally empty, and the service cheerful. Our room smelt musty, but not enough to make an issue of it. We did experience one-off problems, first with our bedlinen (Queen sheets on a King bed = crumpled night time chaos) and with an overflowing toilet, both were resolved very swiftly. We put our trust in the concierge service for dining recommendations, car rental and booking a shuttle to the airport and in all three areas we experienced inconsistency and even poor service. We asked for reservations on two restaurants which we were told didn't do dinners and when we turned up in person found out they did (but with walk in reservations), concierge should really have known this about popular venues in La Jolla. We booked a car rental smoothly but asked for the final bill to be relayed via the valet and this was still not forthcoming when we left (may be more to do with the rental firm), the doormen and valet were at all times really excellent and helpful with our travel requests. The final issue made us super irritated, we had booked an airport shuttle via concierge for our departure and had the reservation confirmation sent to our room. On the day of departure we sat in the foyer waiting... on checking the reservation sheets (we were sent two - inexplicably) one had been booked for two days previous and one for the next day. Neither booking was for the actual date requested. The staff did come up with a solution, they booked us a taxi and gave us the difference in cash, which considering the anxiety and inconvenience caused we thought was rather mean.... we did get to the airport OK but with very little time to complete security etc. We had a lovely time in La Jolla, but won't return to the Hyatt Regency or recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - Vey good for Business Traveler - So so for Family”
Reviews.Author: LetterK
Reviews.Content: Brought my family to SD for a 4 day trip. As others said parking in available on the street, but with young kids and my wife I parked in the garage. One of the main available streets is super busy. Dining options near the hotel are good for the business meal or person with the expense account, but not sure much for the family. There are many options and with University nearby many cheaper options. This hotel is very much a business hotel. It's not a surprise and it shouldn't be to anyone, that this level of hotel charges for Wifi or parking. The only issue is the parking fee per day is ridiculously high. The pluses are the housekeeping service and the staff interaction I had were good. The rooms are nice and tastefully decorated. The soaps and extras were nice and better than any other 4* hotel I stayed at. Access to the hotel is right by the freeway and close to La Jolla Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, boring -- and expensive”
Reviews.Author: larry_nyc
Reviews.Content: When traveling for business, I'm more of a Hyatt Place kind of guy (see prior reviews) so when I had to stay at the Regency for work, I was excited because I've been such a fan of Hyatt for so long. The disappointment set in immediately. Rooms were $200 a night including tax, which for San Diego and La Jolla, is on the higher side of average, but not terrible. It's the "amenities" that made this stay appalling. $20 per day for parking, $15 per day for Internet, no coffee/breakfast that you didn't pay for, and a surly set of staff that was more interested in looking good than providing good service. But the most annoying part was the inability to find an electrical outlet in the room. There was one outlet, which became my hub for my laptop, phone, and ironing in the morning. No plugs near the bed. The hotel layout is confusing, so much so that the ladies in front of me had to get an escort to their car in the parking deck. The surrounding restaurants are all decent but also very pricey. No such thing as cheap eats here! It again reinforces my professional and personal feeling that staying at expensive hotels are not worth the cost. This certainly was not. I missed my Hyatt Place.

Reviews.Title: “Easy and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Umfalotta
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed at this Hyatt a number of times over the years, and we are generally very satisfied. We've found the service friendly and professional, and the rooms and public areas are attractive and comfortable. Plenty of food and refreshment options right on the property, and the pool is nice. It's also nice that there is now a complimentary workout facility in the hotel, in addition to the health club guests used to have to pay to use. As many others have said here, the parking situation is aggravating, as $20-$25 for parking in SD seems awfully expensive, and the garage doesn't even offer the total convenience of direct access into the hotel, but requires a brief outside walk by the pool and then an elevator or stairs. We opted to search for street parking, which is usually available and not much farther of a walk from the hotel than the garage. As others have also noted here, the bathrooms look a little tired, especially compared to other Hyatts we've recently visited, but that wouldn't deter us from returning.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay but hotel needs some updating.”
Reviews.Author: Empress777
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a quick weekend getaway and booked two rooms through Hyatt.com since I am a Gold Passport member. Overall, we had mixed reviews about this hotel, so I'm not sure I would consider going back. NEGATIVES: --SELF-PARKING IS $20!!! Valet is $25!!! Outrageous. We tried to find street parking at night, but since everyone else was trying to avoid paying this exorbitant fee, street parking was full. We were informed that the parking garage is NOT the property of Hyatt, hence they were unable to waive the fee or adjust it in any way. This is unacceptable. How could a hotel NOT have its own parking? And there was no mention of this fee on their website when booking, which makes it all the more annoying. This is pure bait-and switch. Thankfully, we only stayed one night. I read another reviewer who mentioned that a 5-night stay could add $100 to your bill! --GOT A SMOKING ROOM WHEN WE REQUESTED NON-SMOKING. Sound like other reviewers had similar problems. --BATHROOM NEEDS UPDATING. The shower fixtures in our room looked like they were about to fall off! Tiles looked dated. --NO SOUNDPROOFING. I agree with other reviewers that the walls have no sound proofing. Every noise from next door (bath and shower, running water) could be easily heard. --HOUSEKEEPING ISSUES? When we checked in to drop off our bags, there were used glasses outside our door, and noticed that several other rooms had dirty dishes in the hallway, waiting to be picked up. When we came back in the evening, the dirty glasses were still there! --NO MINIBAR OR COFFEE MAKER IN ROOM. So don't be afraid to ask for coffee vouchers at check-in. POSITIVES: --PLEASANT CHECK-IN. Staff member Pedro was friendly and pleasant to deal with. He was very helpful and offered coffee vouchers, maps to the city, local recommendations, etc. One other reviewer mentioned him by name--Hyatt management would do well to commend him for doing his job well. You would be surprised how other 4- or 5-star hotels mess up the check-in experience. --GOOD DINING OPTIONS. At least four fine-dining restaurants are located across the street. -- QUICK RESPONSE TO ROOM CONCERNS. With the issues about the room mentioned above, I called the Front Desk to see if it was possible to be switched to a different room. Unfortunately, the hotel was fully booked, but they immediately offered a price adjustment. Also, within 10 minutes of calling, someone from housekeeping was there to "freshen up" the room (as usual, all they can really do is spray the room with a neutralizing freshener to cover up the smoke smell) and pick up the dirty glasses. And also within 10 minutes, someone from engineering was there to check in on the bathroom fixtures. While they weren't really able to do much, it was at least nice to see that they responded quickly and made you feel that they weren't just ignoring your concerns. Like I mentioned, a mixed review overall. Not sure I can recommend this hotel, and not sure if I'd consider going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, but issues elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: puzzolente
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a full week on a split family/business trip, so feel like I got to know this hotel pretty well. Pros: • Location strikes a good balance for S.D. area attractions--easy access to La Jolla, near enough to the 5 freeway that beaches, Balboa Park/zoo and downtown are all surprisingly reachable with S.D.'s fairly moderate traffic, even Torrey Pines relatively close. • Typical strong Hyatt service at the front desk and in housekeeping. A rollaway bed was brought to our room and set up promptly after a single request. • Room was nicely furnished--not exactly luxurious, but clean and contemporary. • In-closet safe big enough to hold a widescreen laptop. • Wonderful free basic laundry/pressing service for up to 12 items. • Outstanding large pool area. Cons: • Thick pillowtop mattress and heavy comforter horribly mismatched for the San Diego climate. We woke sweating every night, even with the A/C cranked down to 64 and just a sheet on. • Bathroom was dingy and not up to snuff. Old beige-y tile never really looked clean. Shower/tub pull and temp control required Herculean effort to operate, and even then tended to leak water. Toilet flush was deafeningly loud, to the point where we thought twice about flushing at night to avoid waking each other up. • Ridiculous parking. $20 a night for self-parking in a far-off garage with narrow spaces. Even after ComicCon was well over, never seemed to have anything available until you wound down a couple of floors. From the giant, car-killing speedbumps on the way in, to finding a space, to navigating the long hike back to the hotel, to actually making it to my room was a good 15 minute process. Every. Single. Time. If you go, I'd recommend hunting for a free space on the street near the north entrance. Unfortunately, the cons impacted too much of the important aspects of our stay to be able to fully recommend this hotel. Especially at $250 or so a night (really $270 with the parking).

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: KikiVisalia
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay and found the hotel staff to be very responsive and attentive. We loved the pool and hot tub and was a perfect escape after a day at the zoo or Sea World. You could bring out drinks from the bar and there was a nice area that was shallow enough for the kids to play. There were also fire pits where you could roast marshmellows. I believe the hotel sold the smore kits but we didn't do it so I don't know the cost. The restaurants were so close that we could walk easily and that was very convenient. Self parking was $20 a day and we never had a hard time finding a spot by the elevator. The biggest down side for us was there was no in-room coffee maker or fridge which was problematic when traveling with a family. We had their Gold Passport and they gave us a free coffee coupon for each day we were there for one person to the Starbucks downstairs. You aren't really close to anything here but you aren't far away either and the hotel is right off highway 5. There was a $14.95 charge per day for WiFi but you could connect for free to the Fitness club when you were at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “While pretty on the outside, we ended up with a two and a half star quality room, with a four star price.”
Reviews.Author: subielover13
Reviews.Content: We had stayed in another Hyatt before, so therefore had higher expectations.The room was comfortable, but lacked the luxuries of seperating it from a basic courtyard Marriott room. We have actually stayed in courtyard Marriotts for less money, that were just as luxurious. It was unreasonable to be asked to pay $25.00 a day for hotel parking, or be given the other option of parking on the street, which was a hassle. We wish we had read a disclaimer that decent parking for a four day stay would cost an extra $100.00. Overall, this hotel was overpriced for being a four star.We could have saved money and stayed at a 3 star hotel in the area for the same amount or less since there was a lack of luxury to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Needs Renovation”
Reviews.Author: lablover99
Reviews.Content: I must start out my review by saying the service that we received was good. The people were very nice. I am a Hyatt gold passport member and so whenever possible I stay at a hyatt. I was a dissappointed with the age the hotel was showing. There is a strange odor in the room and hall ways. The air conditioner was not working properly and seemed to be blowing more lukewarm air instead of cold. The room was clean but the tub had chips and the sink too. You could see some mold in the corner of the shower and the floor tiles or something dark. When you turn the bathroom faucet on the water started to smell like rotten eggs after awhile. They don't have coffee makers in the room. I did find out on my second day that because I was a gold passport member I could get a free coffee card to use at the coffee counter in the lobby. Only found this out because I was at the front desk and overheard another guest asking for one. Would have been nice to hear about that at check in. They have a decent workout room and you can use it free of charge with your stay. Don't confuse it with the spa and fitness center. If you go there they will hit you up for a 13.00 day pass which is another item that should have been brought up at check in. They charge 20.00 a night for self parking. I feel this is way too steep. Really outrageous. We did speak with the manager on duty, Victoria and let her know our concerns about the hotel and she was very gracious and offered to comp us for 1 nite. That was very generous of her. I hope the Hyatt corporation can put some money into this hotel, They certainly charge enough over $200.00 a night for this time of year. Plus that 20.00 parking fee has to be making them money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel. Service can be improved.”
Reviews.Author: bjishi
Reviews.Content: Nice clean large hotel with a very nice pool and a full service gym ($13 per day). Good food at the restaurants. I have nothing negative to say except that the staff is very indifferent. They don't care and can be rude at times. The valet guys have an attitude ($25 per day should buy me respect + parking spot!) Front desk staff never gave us our breakfast coupons, so we ended loosing that! The computer system was down for a day or so which caused so much confusion. The staff needs retraining. The need to make the customers feel appreciated and respected. I witnessed the front desk lady give a a family with kids a smoking room despite them pleading for a nonsmoking. I am not sure why or if she had a good reason, but the way she handled it was sickening. She did not care, rolled her eyes a few times too! The ONLY person at this hotel that knows how to treat customers, is Pedro at the front desk. He really belongs at a Four Seasons if you ask me! He helped us with directions, dinning suggestions, amusement park questions, and so much more. Not once did he make us feel like we bothered him. He made us feel welcome and felt we had a friend in San Diego! Thank you Pedro. The hotel is a 4 star. The staff brought it down to a three for me.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: SNKmom
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this Hyatt as a part of our family vacation to california. The staff here was superb! We arrived about 1am Tuesday morning and it was just as if it were noon. The security took our bags and delivered them to our room. Great perk since we were traveling with a 9month old and 9year old, both sound asleep! There were several resteraunts near the hotel and Whole Foods within a 3 minute drive. We were centerally located to Legoland and San Deigo Zoo. We were able to enjoy the conceirge level on the 16th floor with breakfast each morning. The cost was a little more for the room, but worth the expense. The ladies that serviced that area were absolutely wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Business Stay”
Reviews.Author: jagtravel
Reviews.Content: I have a love-hate thing with Hyatt properties. Some just irritate the heck out of me for various reasons, others are consistently impressive and reliable. Hyatt Regency in La Jolla fits in the latter category. I waited until my second stay here to confirm the initially positive impression. I see from other reviews that there are some bad experiences, especially with vacationers and families, but for general business travel, which is my primary experience, you are hard pressed to find comparable lodging (although the Marriott a few blocks down the road is also quite good). The hotel location is not La Jolla per se, you are off the highway, not at the shopping area or at La Jolla Cove, those are 10-20 minutes away by car depending on the local traffic. You will be about 15-20 minutes from downtown San Diego and the attractions. Also for families with small kids: about 30-40 minutes from Lego Land. Actual stay: Rooms are a reasonable size, very clean, and beds are very comfortable. Lobby staff is very welcoming in my experience. Location is also very quiet if you value sleep. Amenities and services for the business traveler are accessible and efficient. The frequent business traveler will likely value certain consistencies in their hotels, and all these are met at this Hyatt. Overall, after a long day of travel and meetings it's very nice to walk into this hotel to begin unwinding. Check it out for a quick business trip in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: FinnWithFins
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel during business trip. Location great, right next to reasonable sized shopping mall and direct traffic connections, offering great access to the beach and main highways. Valet parking was fast and professional. Stayed in basic room, which was very simple with very small window. Breakfast was one of the best so far, reminded more like 5 star hotel breakfast from tropical part of asia with large selection of fruits and drinks. As personal favourite, all caffee types were provided by Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “No problems, smooth visit”
Reviews.Author: fourseat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this Hyatt for 6 nights while he was in town doing research at UCSD. The hotel is located super conveniently to the university--less than a 5 minute drive--and is also very close to the I-5 interstate and a variety of malls and shopping centers. It is a huge building with an impressive lobby area. We did not eat at the hotel for meals and usually preferred to go out for coffee in the morning, but there is a small coffee shop in the lobby in addition to a restaurant and bar. The pool area was great, and there is a fitness center, but you have to pay extra for it, which wasn't something we wanted to do. Parking is pricey at $20-25, but there is a decent amount of free street parking within easy walking distance, so we ended up parking on the street for our entire stay. $10/day for the internet is always a bummer--when will these giant full service hotels stop charging people for the internet?? Although the room itself was not in brand new condition, it was clean and well maintained--no complaints. Without exception, I found the staff to be extremely friendly and the service very accommodating. Everyone always had a smile, and all my requests (mini fridge, wine glasses, etc.) were handled promptly and pleasantly. Afternoon cookies and lemonade were a bonus. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very accommodating!”
Reviews.Author: eroonee
Reviews.Content: We stayed there with our 9 month old and we felt we were at home. Our room had minor plumbing issues and we realized there wasn't a small fridge in the room when we arrived. Before the conversation was over on the phone with the front desk, there was a knock on the door and we had the engineer at the door with a fridge in hand and his tools to fix the drain. We ended up switching rooms without any hassle. The next day when we returned to our room, there was a wine and cheese spread waiting for us with a nice note from the manager and the front desk representative. We will be back again and look forward to it! Thank you for all you did to make our stay very comfortable and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient for business in La Jolla”
Reviews.Author: dkmr
Reviews.Content: I stay here often, usually just a day or two at a time. Great location for business in the La Jolla area. Excellent staff and service. Nicely appointed rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: ATLBob
Reviews.Content: We were here for business (conference being held at the hotel.) Check in and out was easy, with efficient/polite staff handling the process flawlessly. The hotel looked shiny and new (but probably just refurbished) rooms were clean, adequate in size and housekeeping seemed to do a very thorough job every day. Parking is expensive ($25 day valet/$20 self park), as is the norm for nicer hotels in the SD area. Hotel is in a location where there are many good restaurant choices nearby--and fairly close to a shopping center/ movie theater, grocery store-a Whole Foods, etc. as well. We enjoyed our stay here and even got to meet a few of the San Francisco 49er team, as they were staying in the hotel ahead of their NFL game vs. the Chargers. We'd definitely consider staying here again when business takes us to La Jolla and the Golden Triangle.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: russianscissors
Reviews.Content: I love coming to visit La Jolla, especially when I get this hotel for a great deal on Priceline. I felt that the room was 'okay' perhaps since I booked on Priceline that maybe I got a room that had a few minor issues that I'm not going to really even mention. They do have valet ($25/day) and self parking ($20/day) but there is plenty of on street parking that is pretty safe, but I would always use common sense. I signed up to be a Hyatt Gold Passport member which I would recommend if you end up getting this room through a site like Priceline/Hotwire. Perks like late check out at 2pm. Also, the pool looked nice but didn't use it. Wish there was free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Had an amazing 30th anniversary...at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ak111123
Reviews.Content: Our children gave us a 2 night stay at this beautiful hotel for our anniversary....Just had an amazing time...excellent location, beautiful hotel ..wonderful staff and the general mgr scott allen upgraded our room...Cannot ask for more...The pool area and the hot tub was great....nice cabanas to relax, really enjoyed the beautiful hotel...Amazing location...within minutes to everything..Fleming's and melting point just across and amc theatre 2 blocks...15 minute walk...and the La jolla cove and beach Few minutes...

Reviews.Title: “Good accommodations for business meeting”
Reviews.Author: rhwanderer
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 days at this site. The staff were very friendly and attentive. The room was standard. The food that was served for our conference was outstanding. The only issue I had was that the location of the hotel did not lend much to do in the evening . If you wanted to go to the beaches of La Jolla or the town center you had to take a taxi. They did have four restaruants right across from the entrance that you could walk to. Took advantage of that two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in La Jolla”
Reviews.Author: CapeCod64
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a business trip to the Hyatt Regency La Jolla. I agree completely with other reviewers - a very good hotel made excellent by the staff. I loved nearly everything about the property - clean, safe, comfortable accommodations, excellent service from all aspects of the hotel and overall a great option in La Jolla for business. The only thing I would change is the lack of dining outlets. While the 4 places across the parking lot are lovely, a place for a quick lunch (aside from the bar) would be a great addition. Also, there is no place in the hotel (again, aside from the bar) that serves dinner, leaving you with the choice of pricy specialty restaurants across the street, or bar food. Be that as it may, the HRLJ is a great hotel in a great location. Loved my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay over Easter weekend”
Reviews.Author: sandnsun61
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had a lovely weekend at the Hyatt La Jolla Aventine. She's attending SDSU and lives in an apartment, but since I was planning a visit for Easter weekend, we decided to make it a fun girls weekend and stay someplace. We took advantage of the "free Sunday" promotion so only paid for two of three nights. We booked a room on the club level enjoy breakfast and snacks as provided. This is most definitely a "business" oriented property, so being charged for parking and internet is to be expected. Our room was great, on a high floor overlooking the pool. The staff throughout the entire property were pleasant and accommodating, from the valets to the front desk folks, to the Michael's bar staff. The only meal we ate at the hotel was in Michael's one evening after spending the day at the Safari Park. Food was very good and our waitress, Konstantina (sp?) was in one of my daughter's classes at State! We ate one dinner across at the Melting Pot and it was excellent as well. Although not a resort-y type of place, the Hyatt La Jolla is certainly a nice option for the area. I like the Hyatt product - consistent and reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: La_pinoy
Reviews.Content: We checked in Saturday 05/14 and arrived early around 11 am. We checked for any available room and they allowed us to checked in since there is one, Checked in was a breeze. We were placed on the 6th floor facing the pool area. I requested ref and coffee maker prior to checking in, (since im a Gold passport member) but there's none in the room so i need to call front desk to bring it. The only thing that is not nice is the parking for a fee $20 for self park and $25 for valet. No free wireless too. But its on their fine print anyways. Considering its an "upscale" hotel chain, people should spend extra for that. The parking lot/spaces are so small, (i have a van). Anyway, if you really like an upscale hotel chain in La Jolla, Hyatt wil be one of the best choices for the price ($99/night on a saturday night)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AuntieMimiLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference. The conference was actually not at this hotel- I chose to stay here instead to avoid noise and traffic of the "conference" hotel. I really like the Hyatt La Jolla. They were super pleasant and professional starting at check-in. The valets are very attentive and professional/polite. Get a package that includes parking. There is some street parking but it's a PAIN. The breakfast buffet is great but they let us substitute with a $$ amt for room service so I could order what I wanted. Including Starbucks! My room was clean enough. Fitness center is an athletic club next door. They charge 12$/day to use. It was worth it to me as the fitness center is really nice. There is also a large pool. Pool is outdoor so I didn't go since it was in October.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with a staff that pushes it to outstanding”
Reviews.Author: ZiggysMom
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with my sister and my three children, and was so worried about getting this hotel on Priceline after reading the reviews. I have absolutely no idea what some of these people are talking about. The hotel was very clean, and the grounds were beautiful. But what really made it special for us was how we were treated. I pulled up to the front of the hotel and asked if I could just unload my luggage, and that I was hoping to get a spot to park on the street. They obliged and helped me with my luggage. Then the bellhop Tony came to assist with getting the bags to our room. He was AMAZING! So helpful with information and making you feel relaxed and comfortable. The hotel wasn't busy, so he even arranged for a late check out for us, and gave me a map of the area including where to eat and how to get to the best beaches. Fresh cookies and lemonade as we set out on our way to SeaWorld were a pleasant surprise. Doors were always opened for us, check in/out was a breeze, and the room was very quiet, spacious and comfortable. Having the adjoining room with the kids was great. We were on the twelfth floor. Not a really pretty view, but at least a little of the pool and the grounds. I do wish they had a mini fridge, but not a big deal on a short stay. When we went to check out, Tony again came up and helped us with our luggage, I didn't even have to tell him our room number or name. He's that good. I hope the hotel knows what a treasure of an employee they have. Even the doorman was very friendly and the valet gave me a rose on Mother's Day. Thank you for making this a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ItsAboutTheTravel
Reviews.Content: Great location especially if you have a car. There are 4 fantastic restaurants across the parking lot from the hotel. The rooms are average, but the hotel staff is fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: LauraBtraveling
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to be close to the university and it is in a great location-close to freeways and walking distance to stores. The lounge was very nice and the bartender was friendly. We were disappointed that the room lacked basic items like a microwave or fridge. Parking was ample but a long walk from the room and $20 per day is more than we've paid anywhere. Stayed at the Marriott down the road the last time we were here and liked it more. My husband and I agreed there was nothing else about this hotel that compelled us to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view”
Reviews.Author: ACPtunnel
Reviews.Content: Two nights in the big city. Fast elevators. Good food. Rooms were typical Hyatt,,upscale, clean and trendy. Property is quiet. Internet kind of sucked, but hey, they probably don't have business class cisco equipment. Garage was typical of a big city environment. Secure/large and easily accessible. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “treated royally at la jolla”
Reviews.Author: melemike
Reviews.Content: there for annual 3 day business meeting that is held around san diego area. hotel was easy to find, lots of parking, lots of friendly staff. even though i didn't have the breakfast chits they were willing to feed me no charge. we are hyatt gold pass members and they upgraded our room to an allergy free environment - ionizer, non-smoking, natural fibers, etc., overlooking the pool. food was excellent - we ate breakfast, lunch and a dinner there. didn't use sports area, but saw others - very clean and spacious. can't say enough about the very helpful and friendly staff - especially melanie, who checked us in and another melanie in the breakfast area working as maitre'd.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing location”
Reviews.Author: corpratemomma
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is a beautiful hotel. The highlight of the hotel is bar. The bartender was extremely friendly and heavy handed with the alcohol.
