Reviews.Content: We arrived the day after Christmas for a two night stay. We had several problems. When we first pulled in the doorman and valets were all standing around as it was very slow period. They were young and unsupervised. We made it clear we did not want valet service as we had valuables in the car and we did not require help with our luggage. They then became rude and abusive, telling us we only had 15 minutes to register or we would be charged and insisted we surrender our keys when all we wanted to do was put our bags inside the door and self park. I should also mention the parking is $17 per night extra for self park and $23 per night for valet. The rooms were small and ordinary, despite being listed as a 4 star by Hotwire. We awoke the next morning to a water leak from the bathroom. Two sides of the carpet around the bathrrom was soaked and clothes we had on the floor were as well. Since the leak was inside the wall we had no idea if the water was waste or supply line. So at 7 in the morning we had to switch rooms. The room we were assigned had a musty smell and dust was on the furnature as if it had not been used in a while. Even more gross one water glass had a white stain on the bottom. I mentioned this to a room cleaner but they never switched the glasses. I noticed on the cart they had no clean glasses. I am guessing the hotel, contrary to health regulations, cleans the glasses in the room. No refund was offered by the hotel as a result of our complaints. Since we booked on Hotwire they really had no way to refund. I would not stay at this property again after this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beds were kinda hard”
Reviews.Author: thatkimgirl07
Reviews.Content: If you have booked a hotel stay thru Priceline, (or another wholesaler) do you ever wonder if you get a room that is "less than"? We recently stayed here, it's a gorgeous hotel, no question about that. The water was out at our apt complex and so at the last minute decided to try Priceline and see what I could get. We got this room for my bid of $115, which I thought was pretty good. The room was fine, however, once again, the bed was just a little bit too firm for my taste. I've stayed at a few Hiltons which had very comfortable beds. We ordered dinner in the room, and they wheeled it in on a round little table. Room service was very good, courteous, etc. I don't know that I'd seek this hotel out again unless I heard they had gotten new beds.

Reviews.Title: “Second time is a charm!”
Reviews.Author: hvtrust
Reviews.Content: This was the second time to stay at the Hyatt Regency La Jolla. Our experience at this hotel was very pleasurable. We visited around the time of all the devasting fires, but the entire time we were there we continued to receive excellent service. The hotel rooms are very clean, spacious, and modern. The front desk staff were helpful and friendly. Each time we received service from anyone on staff, it was prompt and friendly. The valet service was very fast and they greet you by name. I like personalized service! The rooms had a coffee maker and mini fridge. If you want to connect to the Internet, there is a service charge of $9.99 per night. Valet parking is $23 and self park is $17. I thought it was just easier to use valet. What I especially liked about this hotel was that it was in a great location. There are plenty of restaurant and shopping areas close to the hotel. In addition, it is located just East of I-5. It's about a 15 minute drive to Sea World, Old Town, the airport, Qualcomm Stadium, Downtown, Balboa Park, etc. The La Jolla area is beautiful and it's just a mini drive to the Del Mar area too. We would definitely stay here a third time!

Reviews.Title: “Just a bed.”
Reviews.Author: scarlet_snowhite
Reviews.Content: We paid full price (300$) for a room in October which is not the tourist season. We mentioned twice that it was our honeymoon, once to the agent who booked us and the second time to the hotel receptionist. Nothing was done to make our stay more memorable - not even a view of La Jolla. The room was nice enough, but the airconditioning did not work (it was cold that night and the airconditioning can only cool, not heat!). The price included NOTHING more than a bed. We felt that this is a business-only hotel and had no room for couples on a romantic getaway. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Wonderful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: perezk27
Reviews.Content: We reserved our stay thru the hotel website and got a great government rate that included a continental breakfast. We arrived at the hotel and we were greeted right away with nice/knowledgeable staff. The check-in process was a breeze. One thing that you should know is that there is a parking fee of $23 for valet - we didn't even consider the self parking (for a few dollars less) because it wasn't very convenient. Our room was not very big and the bathroom was kinda small - but it was very clean and everything was in working order. There is a restaurant inside the hotel ("Michael's") but not they are not very kid friendly and the're expensive. We ate breakfast everyday at the "Barcino Grill" - although our stay included a free continental breakfast, we had to pay $7 more per person if we wanted to upgrade to their full breakfast buffet. It was worth it considering that my two kids (ages 5 & 2) get to eat for FREE! On our first day, we decided to walk to the nearby Westfield Mall which is about 3 blocks away. We had late lunch at the food court and the kids had fun watching people in the ice skating rink (inside the food court). We also had a chance to order from the hotels room service menu - not only was it pricey but they also charge you $3.00 service fee and a whooping 22% fee on top of that and not to mention the tip! The hotel also boasts an adjoining fitness center - but again, for a fee ($12 for hotel guests or $10 if you have the Hyatt Gold Card). Across the street from the hotel (a very short walk) are 4 restaurants to choose from - Cafe Japengo (sushi), Melting Pot (fondue), Flemings (steak) and Blue Coral (sea food). We actually had the chance to try out Cafe Japengo and the food was really good. We really loved our stay until our last night there. The Hyatt hosted a HUGE party for Qualcomm and we were told that approximately 4500 people were in attendance. Needless to say, we opted not to go anywhere on our last night since we didn't really want to mess with the crown downstairs and not to mention messing with the valet and traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: ValueSeekerRW
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 year son and I stayed here just one night for a weekend getaway. We got a great rate through Hotwire.com and as such were very impressed with the value for our money! The hotel itself is beautifully decorated and the beds were super comfy. We didn't try the pool ourselves, but the family traveling with us did and they loved it. Customer service is generally very attentive. When we called down to the front desk or picked up our car from the valet, they always addressed us by name. Unfortunately, check-in took an ungodly amount of time--I think they were training someone new. Restaurants in the hotel and immediately outside its doorway are not family-oriented, but several strip malls (including a Whole Foods market and TGIFridays) are just a short drive (or a brisk walk if you're so inclined) away via the highway overpass. Its location isn't in the heart of what vacationers would typically seek in La Jolla. The main tourist and beach areas are aboue a 10 minute drive away. But we liked it as a roughly halfway point between San Diego and Carlsbad (Legoland).

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: havanahipster
Reviews.Content: I don't normally stay at Hyatt Hotels but I have to say my experience at this hotel might make me reconsider that. The complex is very clean, well-maintained--it feels new. What's exceptional about this hotel is the professionalism and attentiveness of the staff. They are very accommodating. I called down for extra hangers and someone knocked at my door no less than 5 minutes later. The rooms have new interior design with clean, sleek lines. I was uber impressed with the fact they have IHome clock radios (the ones that allow you to dock and play your Ipod...love that). A nice stay. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The LaJolla Hyatt Club Level is excellent!”
Reviews.Author: 2success
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the LaJolla Hyatt for three nights earlier this month. Booked a room in the Club Level and it was worth the extra charge. This is a newer hotel and is in the business district, so if the point of your vacation is to stay in a tourist-y spot, do not stay here. This hotel was definitely a business hotel. Staying on the Club floor provides opportunities to meet other travelers for breakfast or afternoon hors d'oeurves. There were very few children on this floor, and those that we did encounter were very well behaved. The included continental breakfast was the same food as in the hotel restaurant, as far as we could tell. The granola was to die for! Added to vanilla yogurt to make a parfait - YUM! Also their fruit was awesome. In the lounge, there are two computers for travelers to use. Some people are very inconsiderate and do not abide by the 15-minute request. Those people should just pay the additional charge and work from their room if they have a laptop. Some people were surfing the web. I used it briefly a couple times to check work emails, but many times there were lines of people waiting to use them. The rooms were freshly redecorated with quality furniture and bedding. The linens were high quality, which was nice. There is nothing worse than scratchy towels and bedding when traveling. Well, there is a lot worse, but that is a pet peeve of mine. Elevators were very fast, but it would be nice if the top levels had their own elevators. While the banks are split from lower to higher, it can take a long time to get from the top floors to lobby level when it stops at every floor. Some people do not know elevator etiquette and jam themselves in an already-crowded elevator instead of waiting for the next one. But that happens everywhere, not just at hotels. It just would be nice to have express elevators for the top few floors (similar to some hotels in Las Vegas). Everything was clean clean clean! Mrs. Clean and Mr. Fixit must work here. Everything was in tip-top shape. The employees were extremely nice, every single one we met. Parking was expensive, but what do you expect? You're in San Diego. We enjoyed the in/out privileges in the garage and parking was plenty. Overall, it was a great experience and we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat Inconvenient”
Reviews.Author: rootymole
Reviews.Content: This is a high-rise hotel in a very busy section of La Jolla. Parking was expensive--$23 a day for valet pkg. and $16 if you parked yourself. The parking garage is down a steep hill and guests who self-park have to go all the way in the back of the garage and hoof it to the elevator. Then you have to get off and walk to another elevator to get to your room. Very inconvenient arrangement. The room was clean but nothing special. No min-refrigerator or microwave, which made it difficult for us as my husband has a chronic health problem. Would have been nice to have a little min-frig. for water bottles, etc. The in-house restaurant was only open for breakfast and lunch, and was expensive--$19 for breakfast buffet. There were four very expensive restaurants across the plaza, but not good for families or the elderly or those on a modest budget. No good family restaurants were in area, though there is a large shopping mall within a mile or two. Hard to find a gas station in this area, too. I would say this place is o.k. for business travelers whose companies pick up the tab, and who are only in the place for a night's rest, but not good for families with children, the elderly, or those desiring really great accommodations. The staff was very pleasant and helpful, though we didn't get a daily newspaper as we were told we would. Housekeeping came late in the day when we were tired and just wanted to be left alone. Won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Expected More”
Reviews.Author: Carmollin
Reviews.Content: Hyatt set in beautiful LaJolla,CA. Nice hotel, but for almost $300 a night I thought the housekeeping would be better. Put in an order for robes that never arrived untiI I finally called to ask. No pool towels. Housekeeping on the second day didn't come until amost 5 PM! (after I, once again, had to ask.) Then they didn't change the glassware and really didn't do all that much to clean up. This is a full service hotel and I expected full service. Otherwise, the hotel itself is beautifully appointed and the catering is to die for.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: Jacksquirt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose to stay at the Hyatt for our honeymoon. I ordered the romance package which put the room at roughly $400 a night. From the moment we stepped in we were treated as second class guests even though according to the package we were suppose to receive VIP service. I ordered flowers through the e-coinsures and they were suppose to be in the room when we arrived, which they were not. I ended up getting roses even though I ordered gerber daisies. The best part was that they did not write anything on the card. I had nice message that was a surprise for my wife and they forgot to put the card with the flowers. I call down to the front desk and am on hold for 10 minutes and when I finally get to talk to someone they tell me they will have to talk to a manager. 40 minutes later a manager calls back and says that they will provide an extravagant gift for their blunder. They sent up a fruit plate, which consisted of a green banana, apple and orange. I could have walked to the closest store and spent $2 for this so called extravagant gift. After dinner and a night cap my wife and I go back to the room. We call room service to see if we can get a bottle of wine. They say no and my wife calls back to try and see why they can't give us a bottle of wine. When she calls the man on the other end refers to her as a drunk and tells her to raid the mini-bar. My wife is insulted I'm angry so I go downstairs to talk to the manager and he tells me that I am just a customer that can't be made happy and there is nothing he can do. So at 1am my wife and I pack our bags and leave the hotel on our Honeymoon! Absolutely, the worst hotel experience I have ever had. The incompetence of the manager and staff was unbelievable. For $400 a night and a honeymoon one would think they could treat us slightly better. My suggestion go to the Marriot, Hilton, or the Super 8 because you will get better service.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best location, but really great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ma377
Reviews.Content: I had a really pleasant stay at this hotel. I can't say the location was the best (but I didn't have a car, which wasn't the best decision!) but the hotel itself was lovely and really well run. My room was very nice (despite having booked it on Hotwire!) and the staff was extremely friendly. Pool was very pleasant, and even room service food was much better than room service usually is. All in all a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre...i have stayed at better for less”
Reviews.Author: northernnellie
Reviews.Content: I was at the Hyatt La Jolla for a business trip. Nice location, but no sign letting me know where to turn into the parking area/driveway. The rooms were okay. Comfy pillows and comforter. Good size room. The room cleaning was average. The hallway on the floor I stayed on was not very clean. It was very over priced on several aspects: they charge for internet in your room (I get it free at chaper hotels--Howard Johnsons, Hampton Inn, and others), there is a fee if you you want to use the fitness area, and the food had exorbitant prices. There was nothing special about the room and service. I have stayed at some nice hotels in San Jose and in Los Angeles, where you have better amenities in the rooms. Would I recommend: sure. nice location, easy to get to, and I felt safe. The pool area was excellent. Happy travels.

Reviews.Title: “exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: savanah11
Reviews.Content: I was booked into the Hyatt as I course I was taking was next door. I must say I was treated to the highest level of service I've had in a long time. The front desk staff could not be more helpful and when I opened a pop and it exploded all over the bed, the housekeeping staff was at my door in less than one minute and the entire bed and mattress cover was changed immediately. I was a little irritated to learn that people staying there at the same time payed $80 per night while I payed over $200. It was centrally located for what we needed (good shopping, nice meals etc). The pool was nice and while it was shared with the gym next door, never seemed to be overly busy. Excellent dining within 1 minute of the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location...”
Reviews.Author: akula1957
Reviews.Content: Worked well for us! We stayed a week at this property. Although not on business, it tuned out to be a great site for our vacation. The room was fine (no musty smell) and the three of us (ages 48, 12, and 9) found the beds to be very comfortable. Good service, clean room, no problems. The lobby was big and gorgeous. The pool exceptional. We were always able to find free parking. For us, the location was exceptional. A short drive to La Jolla --- try George's rooftop --- great food and reasonably priced. Also a short drive to the Zoo/Balboa Park. The hotel has about three fairly good restauants right outside the lobby. Five minutes away are multiple places to eat including the California Pizza Kitchen which was very good. We went to one of the nearby supermarkets and brought fresh food back to the room for late night snacks --- this was fun. Definitely go to the Zoo and Balboa Park. Walk around La Jolla and enjoy some fine food and sun. Skip the nearby Scripps Aquarium.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay...”
Reviews.Author: TravelingfromSF
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt. The staff were very courteous and helpful, and catered to all our needs, starting with honoring my request for a room on a higher floor and even setting the alarm clock, which we could not figure out for our lives (you have to take the back off - btw). The hotel itself is quite nice, as they have recently renovated. Since we have a seven year old daughter, the pool and sauna were major attractions for us. It's a beautiful pool, heated, and well maintained (in fact, they closed the pool for during the one evening when we were ready to swim - a minor inconvenience). Parking is $17 a day, higher than I would expect in non-metro area for self service parking. Or you can chance parking on the street. The breakfast buffet was also decent, but a little pricey. Also, the location is surprisingly close to many attractions, including downtown La Jolla, downtown San Diego, the zoo, sea world, and the like. Overall, a very favorable experience, and we would both recommend and return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at The Hyatt Regency but.......”
Reviews.Author: michmouse
Reviews.Content: We booked this property through Priceline for four nights and paid 80.00 per night when the rack rate was 249.00. We were very happy with the price paid for the accomodations, but would not consider staying here at the rack rate. The hotel is located right next to San Diego Interstate 5, and the hotel shares its pool area with a busy gym that is next to the hotel. Not exactly a four star situation. Extra and possibly unexpected costs include fifteen dollars a day for the use of the gym (per person) and vallet parking is 22.00. The staff was very helpful with directions and information, and the hotel is conveniently located to many of San Diegos attractions. (Don't miss the seals in La Jolla or a sunset dinner sitting at a waterside table at Jakes Del Mar.) In reference to the other comments that the hotel used some foul/smelly cleaning agents, I must include that I developed a cold/allergies the next morning after checking in. This could be from the traveling, but this situation has been reported here on TA numerous times, so I felt I should add this to the review. We loved San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay at the Hyatt Regency La Jolla”
Reviews.Author: StraitGirl
Reviews.Content: Initially, I was a little concerned about staying here after reading several negative reviews of this property. I was attending a conference at this hotel so I really had no choice, unless I wanted to commute from another hotel each day. However, our stay was a very pleasant one. The front desk staff greeted us promptly at check-in and even gave us breakfast coupons to use each morning at no additional charge. Any time I needed something, they were more than accommodating and friendly to us. As with most other upscale hotels such as this one, the Bellmen are quite insistent on taking your luggage from you and toting it to your room. My husband and I really prefer to do all of this ourselves for various reasons, but this Bellman was not about to take no for an answer. So I let him do his job and tipped him accordingly. However, when I would see him again in the hotel, he acted as if he had never even seen me before. Our eighth floor room had a nice view overlooking the pool area. The bathroom was a nice size - larger than the average hotel bath. It didn't feel cramped like most others. Everything was very clean and in working order. Well, almost everything. The A/C cooled the room but it never seemed to remove the humidity as it should. The room always felt muggy. But since the weather in La Jolla is a beautiful 70 degrees, we just opened the window and enjoyed the breeze, even at night. Our room had an iron/ironing board, a normal size hair dryer (not one of those compact models), and a safe to store your valuables in. This was a nice ammenity. The bed was one of the best we've slept on. Very comfortable mattress along with down bedding. About the only time we heard noises outside our room was during the day while housekeeping was busy cleaning rooms, which is to be expected. It was quiet at night time. I do not recommend using room service at this hotel. If you do, be sure you ask for it to be delivered at least 15-30 minutes before you need it. That way it might actually be on time. They are quite slow here. I've stayed at a lot of nice hotels such as this one and have yet to find one that has acceptable room service. The food was good once I received it, even though the order was never exactly as I had requested it. (One morning I received a phone call at 4:30 AM telling me my breakfast was ready. I had asked for it to be delivered at 7:00 AM! ) The hotel conference facilities were very nice. The staff did a nice job of making sure we had plenty of beverages for breaks. The hotel provided lunch for us during the conference - both days the lunch was very good. The serving staff did an excellent job here, too. We used valet parking for our rental car. The valet staff is the best I have seen. Very prompt and courteous. The valet parking is $22 a day, however, we were only charged a one time fee of $20. I'm not sure if that was a mistake or intentional, but I didn't argue with it! Even if you don't have a rental car, taxis are plentiful. Also, there are several restaurants just steps (literally) from the hotel door: Fleming's and The Melting Pot, along with a few others. I highly recommend both of these. Downton La Jolla is a beautiful place on the coast with lots of restaurants and shopping. It's about a 10 minute drive from the hotel. My husband and I were pleased with our stay at the Hyatt Regency La Jolla. We would not hesitate to stay here again, should we be so luck yas to return to La Jolla/San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, overrated”
Reviews.Author: kboyken
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hyatt Regency at La Jolla got off on the wrong foot when the type of room we'd reserved was not available at check-in. We'd reserved a king, but the only king available had a wet carpet, which turned out to be the result of a leaky toilet. My wife and I spent our first night in a room with two double beds. We were moved to a king-bed room the next morning, but that night, we cranked the thermostat up to 80 and shivered under our blankets, waiting for the heat to come up. We finally called the desk, and the hotel engineer came up, investigated, and told us we'd have to move to yet another room the next day. The heat finally did come on, so we decided to stay put. Each evening, we had to kick the thermostat way up, then dial it way down in the morning. A couple of other things annoyed us during our stay. For what we were paying for a room, we were disappointed to find that a lot was extra--parking, the sports club, breakfast. The restaurants next door were very up-scale and expensive. If we wanted a simple meal, we found that Michael's, the lounge, did serve tasty and reasonably priced food. Maybe my wife and I aren't Hyatt people, but the experience left a lot to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and luxurious hotel.”
Reviews.Author: old_motters
Reviews.Content: Having had to check out of a previous hotel early, we walked into this one and felt instantly happier and pleased that we were going to be staying here. The lobby is plush and comfortable. Check in desk is hidden away to the left. The desk staff were very friendly (and remained so throughout our 8 night stay) and we were in our room after a few minutes. The rooms are not big but they more than make up for it terms of comfort and ambience. The furnishings were pleasant and comfortable. The bed and pillows were comfortable although ours squeaked a little bit, but not enough to cause us any problems. I am sure if we'd wanted to do something about it, it would have been no problem. On the 11th floor we had a very nice view of the pool area and the hotel grounds. The ability to open a big window was also a very nice feature. The tv is an old style set but it's no big shakes to me. The bathroom was small but immaculate throughtout our stay. The shower was fine, which was a blessing after our previous hotel. The products were generally good too, although I found the soap dried my skin too much so had to stop using it. The only complaint in this area was that the towels were a little scratchy and could use replacing. The hotel has a small coffee bar that is open til 11am which serves tea, coffee and pastries. This is a blessing since the buffet breakfast is a little on the expensive side. I also used the outdoor heated swimming pool a couple of times. Although I am sure there was somewhere to change, I couldn't find it so used the mens room. It's a nice facility to have and that it's heated makes a difference especially in december when I was there. Parking is also a little expensive and this is certainly a deterrent from using it at $16 a day. As is the distance from the car park to the hotel itself, vast areas are sectioned off for valet parking which means self parking is relegated to the distant spots. We gave up on it the first day we were there and parked on the street for free and usually closer to the hotel entrances. For a decent breakfast outside the hotel I recomend Le Peep, it's a few minutes drive to Towne Centre Drive, located in the shopping plaza. It's not the big Westfield UTC mall, but a smaller plaza a couple of hundred yards further along the road. Be aware it shuts at 2pm. Nearby shopping at UTC is excellent, one of the best malls in San Diego IMO. There's also a smaller mall and AMC movie theatre across the I5 freeway, visible from the hotel, you can use Nobel Rd to get there easily. Overall, this is my second favourite hotel in San Diego, (after the Omni), it's convienient for most of the city, it's comfortable and the staff are excellent. We didn't leave our room until 4pm one day and upon our return our room was still made up even though we weren't expecting it. In my mind, this going the extra mile makes a difference and I would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Value with Priceline”
Reviews.Author: PalmsandSun
Reviews.Content: We bid on the San Diego area and got the Hyatt La Jolla for $72 a night. Mid-week in early December. Only one night, so just will give a brief review. You definitely need a car, not the best location. We did manage to find a spot on the street to park and avoid the high parking fees. Large heated pool was great first thing in the morning. The breakfast was pretty blah, I would avoid the hotel restaurant with so many great places to eat in the SD area. Hotel looked well maintained and the room was clean. Staff was okay, not overly friendly. I would not pay much more than the rate we got it. But can't complain really, just nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: CAStein
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights at this property recently. Hotel is just east of the I-5, near the UCSD campus and a large mall mall was just down the street. My first room was "over-deodorized" resulting in a less restful night due to allergies. My room was switched the following day to a higher floor with a view of the hotel pool and west to the I-5 and La Jolla beyond. The room was clean and fresh even without articial deodorent. The hotel looked newer and featured an outdoor pool with lap lanes in addition to the standard "play" area. Adjacent to the hotel were a couple of nice upscale restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Picky Traveler Recommends the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: tuimarion
Reviews.Content: I am a picky traveler, who typically prefers 4 star (and above) hotels and resorts, and this hotel fulfilled our needs. We had no security issues, or other problems. PROS: The hotel is beautiful, with convenient access to La Jolla's great downtown shopping and ocean-view dining (can't miss Crab Catcher and George’s at the Cove) …also in close proximity to San Diego (15 min), and Legoland (20 min). The lobby, rooms, hallways, and elevators are very clean and decorated beautifully--in browns and mints. The lounge is very classy, with helpful staff, pool tables, and a nice selection of beverages. CONS: The self-parking garage is very inconvenient at $16 per day, so we used the valet parking at $22 per day, plus tips. The self-parking price should be included in the stay, due to it's inconvenience--all the good spaces are taken by the valet company anyway. The hotel breakfast is very good; but pretty pricey, considering it's similarity to continental style with eggs. I would recommend this hotel for sight-seers, business travelers, and small families.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hyatte”
Reviews.Author: 1boy
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency La Jolla was a great hotel. The rooms are nicely decorated, clean and the beds are very comfortable. The staff is friendly, from the valet, front desk, and even hotel security. The location is terrific; close to the beach, and all major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “They have some issues!”
Reviews.Author: Sue&Jim
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here while he had business in the area. The hotel lobby is a bit massive, dark and rather chilly. We had a rental car- they charge alot for parking, but we were able to find street parking close by on a couple of occasions. The hotel is NOT within walking distance to LaJolla village, so don't stay here if that's what you are looking for. We are sensitive to odors and found our room had a moldy musty smell. They sent up a contraption to remedy this, which didn't work. They then sprayed some horrid fragrance to mask the odor, which only compounded the problem. One of the staff later admitted that they had shampoo'd the carpet and it was still wet, which created the mold problem in many rooms. We were given concierge floor privileges to make amends for this, since there were no rooms avaialble of equal value. This helped. The staff tried to be helpful- they just can't handle certain things, I guess. Carpet cleaning has to be a common occurence in large hotel chains- couldn't they consult their "Hyatt how-to manual" for instructions? The pool area is lovely when not too crowded. I am not that crazy about the area, so would not stay here unless I had to. Disappointed with Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful but expensive”
Reviews.Author: alwysonvac
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel, nice pool- although they rope off three lanes of the pool for lap swimming. Parking is a pain, but you can self park in garage and take elevator up. Parking not as bad as some reviews that I read before I went. $18 a day is high, this isn't manhattan! Lunch at pool was $55 (2 sandwichs and personal pizza with soda). Didn't eat at hotel again after that. Rooms are beautiful and clean- wish they had a safe instead of a mini bar. Front desk is helpful for tourism. Hint- nearby is a bakery/restaurant called Elijah's- simple "diner" type which was great for breakfast. Only stayed here because of Government rate which was $130. Would stay here again at that rate.

Reviews.Title: “Hot and Sticky!”
Reviews.Author: wendydave
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I had planned a lovely 4 days in San Diego to celebrate her birthday - I choosed the Hyatt mainly because of the area (La Jolla) and the bed and breakfast package (standard room $249.00 from Wed-Sun includes breakfast and valet). For 2 weeks prior to our arrival I had been in contact with the Concierge for small items I wanted placed in the room for the surprise. The last email I received before we left Atlanta was "everything is set". Now, here comes the real story - nothing was set up, the room was smelly (I'm serious) and the air condition did not work - I had roses delivered to the hotel for my spouse and they were lost. It was very disappointing to me because I had stayed in communications with the concierge over these items. In any event, the next day (THURS) the manager did respond quickly and did not charge me for the room that previous night - our stay henceforth was wonderful! Only thing is that breakfast bar is VERY busy on Sunday's.

Reviews.Title: “another security issue?”
Reviews.Author: gadget1066
Reviews.Content: Like the last review, we had a small jewelry box dissapear, during our stay at the Hyatt Regency at Aventine. I hadn't read the reviews of the hotel before-hand, but It looks like there's a thief on the staff at the hotel. Otherwise, we had an excellent stay. Being from the east coast, and having a two year old, we were up very early. Nothing in the hotel was open before 6:00, except the pool (which was very nice, and open at 5:00am, although I can't imagine why) So no coffee for us early risers until 6:00. The area surrounding the hotel is devoid of life, unless you have a car. Then you've got options. The hotel is a short drive from la Jolla, which is really nice (and not crowded at all) at daybreak.

Reviews.Title: “Security Issues”
Reviews.Author: chellebelle05
Reviews.Content: My fiancée, a military officer, and I stayed at this hotel while visiting my brother. The hotel is very nice and clean, but while staying there, we had over two-hundred dollars worth of amusement park tickets "disappear" from our room. After searching from top to bottom in our room several times, we went to report the matter to the front desk. The lady at the desk was very nice and polite and immediately called security for us. When the gentlemen from security came, he asked us what the problem was; after we told him what happened, he asked us what we wanted him to do. I was completely shocked by this response as it was completely unprofessional. We asked him to check who had entered the room besides us from the time of our arrival. He told us he would know immediately if anyone else had entered and that he would call us. We waited for several hours and never received a phone call. We finally called the hotel and they claimed that we were the only ones who had entered the room. We then returned to the hotel so that we could see the security report. They claimed that they could not print it out to show us. It was only when my older brother asked for the manager and asked her to show us the report did they finally decide that they could comply with our request (we had to wait about 20 minutes to finally see it). According to them, we must have lost the folder while we were in the room. There was never an apology for the inconvenience. The manager that we spoke to was neither polite nor apologetic. For the rest of our 4 day stay, we had to take all of our belongings to my brother’s house in PB. If it was not for the security issue and the lack of respect we were treated with, I would recommend this hotel (provided that you can obtain it at a discounted price as it is not worth their usual rate).

Reviews.Title: “From a Travel Professional Not Quite Regency Standards”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was there to do an inspection of several properties while in La Jolla for my work, and found some items worth noting. Upon arrival - if you arrive in the evening beware: Its very easy to miss the entrance of the hotel. There is no signage anywhere along the street which driveway to enter, and where the lobby was located. The entrance that we did end up coming in we actually left again, because we thought we were in the service entrance, as the parking garage, and lower levels had trucks unloading there. No grand entrance into a lobby, the restaurant next door Michaels was well lit up and thought there was just valet into their restaurant. Check in - Again arriving shortly after midnight, there was no bell staff, door men, or valet car attendants outside, to give any indication that we were in the right spot, and no one was behind the small front desk counter. Just a sign that said ring bell... The reception staff that came out, was extremely helpful and kind and had us in our room on the club level in a hurry. We were starving and when we got to our room, we rang for room service. We waited and waited for the phone to answer, placed our order, and waited. Not too long, but our food arrived, and it was delivered by "the same front desk agent/ bellman (he brought our luggage up as well) and he said, oh i grabbed you extra dressing as well, for your salad, so i asked him if he prepared the salads as well. By the exhausted look on his face, and the sweat running down his face, it appeared that he did everything after midnight. And then i just felt bad. This was not Regency standards, and this guy was definately overworked. The Caesars chicken salad, had raw chicken, so couldnt eat it, that salad, and a sandwich was 39.00. Ouch. Pool area next day, was super fantastic, and staff was amazing, even under the worst case scenario, not enough chairs, not enough staff, and the place was packed for the 4th of july weekend. But they were gracious, and kind and handled the pressure well, for the most part, with the exception of one poor girl, who was abused by an irrate guest and walked off the job, leaving her collegues in a bind. The pool manager, she did a great job, trying to keep cheerful, and clearing, serving all in a black suite with 90 degree temperature. Well done there! One of our other rooms, had the air conditioning go out and it took the hotel 4 days into our 5 day stay there to fix it. The health club, and excercise area, was one of the nicest i have seen, great equipment, and roomy, 2 story building... fantastic. However, we booked 3 full hour massages, 2 full facials, at their last appointment on Sunday evening at 7pm. Finished by 8pm, and we were still wet from the shower, and the "contracted spa staff" tried to take our towels away from us at 805pm, saying that they were closing and 9 staff members were waiting to leave. We had just spent over 700.00 and we couldnt take a shower>? So i suggested that they make their last appt time at 630pm, so that they can close at 800pm without insulting a guest. Staff otherwise, in all areas, were completely up to par, friendly and helpful. Overall, i love the hotel, location and i say its just a Hyatt, not a Regency.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ZoomLady
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on business in mid-June. While you do need a car to get where you want to go, the hotel well located, very upscale and comfortable. The room, including the bathroom, were nicely done. There are many restaurants within walking distance, all pricey but with excellent food. While I did not have the time to play tourist in this area, the pool and gym facilities were large -- almost Hearst Castle looking -- and I would have enjoyed using the facilities had time allowed. Breakfast buffet is pricey, but ordering off the menu is easier on the wallet and the food was nicely prepared and tasty. Service at the hotel and restaurant was excellent and friendly. Would love to come here to play instead of work!

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are planning a trip to the San Diego area, I highly recommend a stop in La Jolla. The village is beautiful and full of things to do. We found the location not only convenient to Torrey Pines, the beach and downtown La Jolla, and a short distance to downtown. The staff at this hotel is superb. My husband and I both commented on the friendly, helpful attitude. The pool area is wonderful as well. It is a great place to get exercise or read a book. The gym connected with the hotel is available at a fee. And, you will find parking available at a fee as well. However, there is street parking available. The rooms were comfortable, clean and chic. The bedding was wonderful. I would book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice But...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel from June 3rd to the 8th; it was a very nice hotel in a great location. ALL THE GOOD: Like I said above the hotel is in a great location, you can get almost anywhere within 15 mins. As for the rooms they look great! They have a wonderful decor and are roomy (by San Diego standards). We ate a couple meals there because we where lazy and didn't want to go out and eat, the first night I thought the prices where way to high, but as the week went on I realized that $60 is pretty much the norm for 2 people. The people that work here are great they remember you and are willing to do just about anything to make you feel at home. A couple days into our vacation our shower was broken (it only put out hot water) and with in 10 mins the maintenance guy was in our room fixing it. They are very willing to help so don't be afraid to ask. ALL THE BAD: When we arrived I asked if they did anything special for people on their anniversary, the registration guy said yes, he gave us a key to the 16th floor which has the regency club (so free snacks, breakfast and etc.) He also said he would send a couple things to our room; however my husband and I never saw that stuff. We went back a couple days later to just inquire as to what had happened and this guy said he would send those up right away, We still have not seen the stuff. As a person who travels every once in a while, I thought for a hotel of this caliber we would have to pay for our meals, V parking... the obvious, but when we got a bill and we realized that they charged us $1.07 for each local call we made (mainly to restaurants to get directions) my husband was not happy. I will tell you up front you have to pay for EVERYTHING extra; the internet is like $10.... just stupid stuff. This is just me but I watch TV before I go to bed to wined down, but the connection was crappy, a few (2 or 3) stations were distorted, had some snow, just stuff that got on my nerves. I never said anything so... I guess I can't complain. I would recommend this Hotel if you get it for the same price we paid, which was $175 a night from Priceline, but I would never pay their regular asking price unless I had no other option.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stay in top hotels all over the country and have to say this is one of the best! The hotel simply has something for everyone and is in a great location! I was there with my family at the end of May, 2006 and everyone loved it. This hotel has to be one of the best hotels I've stayed in. I stayed in two other Hyatts on my trip and neither compared to this one. Thanks guys!

Reviews.Title: “Could Have Been Better”
Reviews.Author: Peripatetic_Engineer
Reviews.Content: I had booked a petit suite. It turned out that it was really 2 rooms with the wall between them removed. They didin't take the opportunity to increase the size of the closets or bathroom, which I feel is a major mistake and makes the room not worth the money. There is a Starbuck's coffe bar in the lobby that is supposed to open at 6:00 AM every day. But nobody showed up on Saturday so it was closed all day. I agree with a previous reviewer that service at breakfast is slow. The hotel is not near public transportation (the closest metro stop is Old Town) so you will need a car. They will charge you to park it and street parking is limited. This hotel is convenient to the University and Scripps but is too far from downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel with Some Issues”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt for business and was not disappointed. The room was large with a very comfortable bed. Like one of the previous reviewers, my room had a very musty smell. Opening the window didn't help at all. I'm thinking that all the rooms must smell like this, but it's not so bad that it detracts from your stay. The bed is extremely comfortable. The bathroom is large and clean. There is very good lighting, which is important for those of us who need to shave in the morning. The water pressure in the shower was excellent and the soaps, shampoo, and conditioner were top quality. One disappointment, however. I left a nice belt behind by accident. When I called to see if it had been found, housekeeping said they never saw it. The breakfast area is nice, but service is very slow. Sometimes you'll have to wait over 5 minutes for a cup of coffee. If you're anxious to get to work, this isn't the place to eat. Parking was convenient, but expensive. The gym is very nice, but costs $10 a day for Hyatt Passport members.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: like2travel006
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 5 nights and loved it. The rooms were clean, the staff was helpful and the location was great. We were close drive to La Jolla Village, Mission Bay, and a few minutes from downtown San Diego. We were here over Valentine's Day and walked over to Flemings for dinner. Well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: aatriplea
Reviews.Content: Truly an awesome place. Booked directly through their website and got a great rate for the product vs. the industrial websites of hotwire, priceline or expedia-yuck! Those websites pay a much lower rate to the hotels and jip the city of the occupancy tax! The hotel was well kept, the attention to detail in the housekeeping department was unbelievable. I think the housekeepers must clean 5 rooms or so a day as our room was spotless each day during our 6 day stay, got cleaner as the week went on. Janet and Benji at the Front Desk were trained as if they went to Hotel School in Switzrland,they were extremely service oriented and even ran into the general manager who took to a geniuine interest in our stay and bought us lattes. The stories go on. And the Health Club, Sporting Club was unbelievable, too bad some of the 45+ ladies have forgot that gravity catches up and they should wear t shirts vs. tights. Te hotel is awesome and at $350/night I think we had a great experience and better than the "luxury" hotels we have stayed at in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, and courteous”
Reviews.Author: sunnygetaway
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed in the Hyatt Regency La Jolla in six months. Since we liked it the last time, we didn't want to mess with another unknown hotel. The rooms are clean and spacious, every amenity is available (though you will pay for it), and the staff is courteous. It is in a very easy location, only 10 minutes to San Diego, and since you have to drive everywhere anyway, this was no big deal to us. Our only complaint was that when we ordered room service it never showed, and when we called to check on our order, they apologized for forgetting to put it in. Unfortunately, they did not take even the dessert off of the bill for the 90 minute wait. We would go back to this hotel again and recommend it with the caveat that everything extra costs extra, no perks for free.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency La Jolla needs housekeeping!”
Reviews.Author: flannelpajamas
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at the Hyatt Regency, La Jolla. It's a lovely hotel from the outside, and the people I've dealt with have been friendly. The problem at this hotel is the housekeeping. This could be an isolated problem, and maybe even one housekeeper. My non-smoking room, has a bathroom that smells like an ash tray. Either the previous guests smoked in the bathroom, and it was never cleaned properly by housekeeping, or housekeeping smokes while he/she cleans the bathroom. I also found hair on my new clean pillow case. I blew this off as "possibly the housekeeper's hair." This is now my second night here, and after returning to my room, I found that my bathroom was not cleaned. My own hair was still in the tub and on the floors. Which leads me to believe that nothing was vacumed or wiped down. If housekeeping can leave the obvious things undone, I am very concerned about the not so obvious things. I am getting more and more paranoid about the original hair in my bed (maybe it was the previous guests or maybe my sheets were never changed). I have already signed and scheduled an event for my company here next month, and I regret doing this. I have a few executives flying out to this event, and I will be embarrassed if they have the same "unclean" experience. I do plan to write the manager (my first time ever) and complain. This is a fairly expensive hotel, so my expectations are high. I have stayed at less expensive hotels where rooms were immaculate. The housekeeping staff at least on the 8th floor needs some re-training or replaced. If you're concerned about cleanliness, especially with a $250 nightly price tag...then this is probably not your hotel. I have stayed at the Embassy Suites, and Hilton Torrey Pines, and have never had a problem at either hotel. Until housekeeping is improved stay away from this hotel or at the very least...don't stay on the 8th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall.”
Reviews.Author: rr0001
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms with a very helpful staff. The parking charge was excessive at $18/day self park and $24 valet. The business center was small and expensive for internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Great Two Nights!”
Reviews.Author: Mikeandcris
Reviews.Content: My family booked this hotel through William Shatner,s website for $95.00 per night for a Fri/Sat stay. Considering the hotel web site was booking at a minimum of $269.00 before tax, I went in with the expectation that I got a great deal....and we were not disappointed. The staff was very friendly (and didn't flinch that we'd obtained the room via P.line) The room was spacious and clean. The two double beds were very comfortable. Even at 10 floors up there is street noise, but once the window is closed, we weren't disturbed by anything. This hotel is attached to a pricey and state of the art health club which comes with a $12.00 fee. However, the pool is free and it's a full-sized (25 yard or meter) pool perfect for swimming laps. As mentioned above, self parking and valet are expensive. However, I found free parking on the street within 50 yards of the hotel one night and 1.4 mile of the hotel the other. If I had paid the full rate, I'd be upset by so many extra costs (health club, parking, etc) but when you start off over $170 below the rack rate, you feel a bit differently. Overall, I"d definitely bid for a 4 star north coast San Diego hotel again and be very happy if it came up with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hating the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a dissappointment! My husband and I were so looking forward to our long weekend trip to San Diego. We booked our hotel through an on line service and were very exicted to be staying at such a beautiful hotel. When we first arrived the room smelled terrible...the bell boy suggested we open a window. Gee, that was helpful. Everything was inconvenient. We were unable to use the state of the art workout room because we could never find anyone to help us. They had lost the key to the mini bar, we never got one. Even the room while we were there was not cleaned very well. dirty cups and papers left in the room. The list goes on and on. I wouldn't stay there again even if it were free.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from our one-year anniversary trip to La Jolla. We read a lot of reviews and looked for the perfect place to stay. We found it in the Hyatt. We had never been to La Jolla before and were really depending on the concierge to guide us once we arrived. From the moment we arrived at the valet, we were greeted by friendly and helpful staff. Our room was very up to date, trendy decorations, great bedding and furniture. The bathroom was good size. Each night the concierge helped guide us to a great dinner. For our anniversary we ate at George's on the Cove. The hotel had relayed that it was our anniversary so they gave us a great table with a wonderful view of the ocean, along with white chocolates that said, "Happy Anniversary" and then a champagne toast at the end of the meal. All thanks to the Hyatt concierge! The hotel bar, Michaels, is great for an early dinner drink or a late night dessert. The chocolate mousse cake was amazing. Each day we did something different and the concierge gave us directions to everywhere we wanted to go. The hotel was beautiful, clean and in close proximity to downtown La Jolla and within walking distance to restaurants and a nice shopping area. We went to the pool just once, but it was very nice. It seemed very family friendly and safe. We ran outside of the hotel area each morning, great workout with lots of hills. My husband and I want to make this trip a yearly tradition. We will definitely go back to this Hyatt again and again. Be sure to utilize the concierge, tell them what you are looking for and they will make it happen! Someone else wrote about the $16 per night self-parking fee (valet is $22 per night), there is space to park on the streets, so there is no need to pay, but the space directly around the hotel seemed limited. If you don't mind walking, save yourself the money. We paid for parking just out of convenience.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful property...iffy food & beverage”
Reviews.Author: enjoyinglifenow
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights at the Hyatt. We were a family of 3...teenage daughter. It is a beautiful building, inside & out. The rooms are of average size but we needed 2 beds and ALL they have are doubles....so since we are used to a King sized bed...the sleep was fitful. On the plus side the linens and furnishings are lovely. The bathroom is nicely appointed with those fabulous "portifino products" Hyatt is known for. The self parking fee of $16/night we found to be ridiculous. Don't bother, we found lots of parking on the side streets. Also found the breakfast buffet to be poorly staffed, every single morning. We were always waiting for it to be refilled and many times had to chase someone down for water, coffee, etc. They have a beautiful pool but the chairs and towels are a bit worn and again the staffing was poor or nonexistent. The frozen drinks were great but we had to go chase them down & then wait a LONG time. Their food/beverage service is very inconsistent!!! If you get a good room rate you will enjoy the property but if you have to pay a full rack rate you might want to search else where.

HotelInfo.Name: Hyatt Regency La Jolla
HotelInfo.Address: 3777 La Jolla Village Drive, San Diego, CA 92122
